programme.title: L'angle mort
programme.desc: Fils de musiciens, Dominick Brassan a le pouvoir de devenir invisible. A près de 40 ans, Dominique passe beaucoup de temps avec sa compagne Viveka, avec laquelle il ne s'est néanmoins pas engagé outre mesure, et travaille comme modeste employé dans une boutique de guitares. Comprenant son potentiel, son patron veut le faire progresser, mais Dominick tien vraisemblablement à rester une place qui ne lui convient pas. Tout comme il cache à tous son don d'invisibilité qu'il n'assume pas du tout.

programme.title: Honey Boy
programme.desc: Comédien enchaînant les projets, Otis a un problème d’alcool. Un jour, il a un accident de voiture. Arrêté, il doit suivre une cure de désintoxication dans le centre du docteur Moreno. Pour la thérapie, cette dernière lui demande de noter ses souvenirs. Otis repense alors à sa vie avec son père, un ancien clown alcoolique et violent, qui lui faisait office d’agent. Ils vivaient ensemble dans une chambre de motel. Au centre, Otis a du mal à participer aux activités de groupe, persuadé que la thérapie ne pourra pas l’aider. Il se replonge toutefois dans son passé.

programme.title: Diabolique
programme.desc: En 1997, une vieille famille de notable de province est réunie au grand complet dans le superbe château familial. Chacun a répondu à l'invitation à déjeuner d'Hélène pour évoquer la réfection du domaine, mais les débats deviennent houleux lorsqu'elle informe ses deux frères que les subventions habituellement allouées ont été coupées. Les deux hommes refusent de participer aux frais et s'en remettent à Hélène pour trouver une solution. Elle rencontre alors un certain Thomas Texier, un charmant trentenaire débordant d'énergie et d'attention qui s'impose rapidement comme un homme providentiel.

programme.title: Peur sur la base
programme.desc: Odessa Berken, adjudante-chef de la gendarmerie maritime, arrive sur la base navale de Brest pour une enquête. L'un des membres de l'unité des fusiliers, Yassin Rhaled a disparu. Le lendemain, le cadavre du vingtenaire est retrouvé au pied des falaises de la presqu'île de Crozon. L'autopsie révèle que le garçon a été assassiné. Sur le camp d'entraînement militaire, l'arrivée d'Odessa ne passe pas inaperçue : cette personne élégante a un caractère bien trempé. Ses premières investigations la conduisent vers un suspect... Nathan Berken, son frère.

programme.title: Démons
programme.desc: Franck et Catarina, un couple d'aristocrates d'origine italienne, s'aiment mais ne se supportent plus. Alors que Franck vient de perdre sa mère, ils accueillent leurs voisins, Jenna et Thomas, qui occupent les dépendances du domaine et viennent d'avoir un nouvel enfant. Au contact des vénéneux Franck et Catarina, ceux-ci prennent conscience des propres failles de leur couple. Rapidement, la situation dégénère.

programme.title: Ava
programme.desc: Ava, 13 ans, passe des vacances avec sa mère, Maud, et sa petite soeur, Inès, dans l'Ouest de la France au bord de la mer. C'est sur une plage qu'elle croise pour la première fois Juan, un jeune homme en fuite accompagné d'un grand chien noir, aux prises avec la police. Le lendemain, au cours d'un rendez-vous chez un ophtalmologiste, l'adolescente apprend qu'elle va progressivement perdre la vue. Un peu plus tard, elle suit Juan, qui est interpellé par un policier dans une supérette. Ava en profite pour partir avec son chien, qu'elle baptise Loupo.

programme.title: Les éblouis
programme.desc: Christine et Frédéric, les parents de la jeune Camille, voudraient intégrer une communauté dirigée par Luc-Marie, le berger. Camille fait un sketch de clown où elle se moque gentiment de la prière. Luc-Marie lui interdit de rester dans son école de cirque. Sa mère, fragile, lui ordonne d'obéir. Les parents de Christine s'inquiètent pour les enfants. Luc-Marie réussit à manipuler Christine afin de les écarter. Camille tombe amoureuse de Boris, un élève de son école de cirque. Quand elle apprend que ses parents ont été dépouillés par la secte, elle se rebelle.

programme.title: The Square
programme.desc: Christian, conservateur d'un musée d'art moderne de Stockholm, répond, après avoir passé une courte nuit, aux questions d'Anne, journaliste de télévision américaine. Peu de temps après, l'élégant quadragénaire se fait voler son téléphone portable en pleine rue. Il se rend ensuite à une réunion pour préparer la communication autour d'une future exposition, intitulée «The Square», qui doit questionner le public sur son rapport à l'altruisme. Dans la journée, aidé par son assistant Michael, il parvient à retrouver le signal émis par le GPS de son téléphone.

programme.title: Snow Therapy
programme.desc: La petite famille suédoise formée par Tomas, son épouse Ebba, et leurs deux enfants Vera et Harry, profite des sports d'hiver dans une station des Alpes françaises. Ces vacances basculent, quand une avalanche menace la famille et les autres vacanciers, qui prenaient du bon temps à la terrasse ensoleillée d'un restaurant. Tout le monde est sauf. Mais, peu de temps après l'événement, au cours d'un repas avec des connaissances, Ebba reproche à Tomas d'avoir pris la fuite sans se soucier des siens. Celui-ci, réfugié dans le déni, s’obstine à taire l’incident.

programme.title: Scènes de la vie conjugale
programme.sub-title: S1 E1 Acte un: innocence et panique

programme.title: L'opéra
programme.desc: Danseuse étoile de Paris, Zoé, 35 ans vit dans l'excès après une carrière au sommet de son art. Sébastien, le nouveau directeur, menace de la renvoyer en raison des nombreuses fêtes et dissipations nocturnes. Elle décide alors de se battre pour conserver sa place.

programme.title: L'opéra
programme.desc: Pour défendre ses intérêts, Zoé fait appel à maître Delva, une avocate qui lui donne un seul conseil : être distribuée le plus possible. Pour cela, elle doit retrouver la forme.

programme.title: Histoire d'un regard
programme.desc: Mariana Otero se souvient du moment où elle a reçu un livre de photographies de Gilles Caron, reporter à la fin des années 1960. Elle se souvient de son émotion en redécouvrant ces images qu'elle connaissait mais dont elle ignorait l'auteur et surtout sa sidération, quand elle a découvert le parcours du photographe, mort à 30 ans au Cambodge, alors que le pays venait de tomber aux mains des khmers rouges. Cette disparition précoce lui a rappelé celle de sa mère, morte au même âge, à la même période. C'est aussi la proximité de ces deux destins qui l'a incitée à dresser un portrait en images de Gilles Caron.

programme.title: King Kong
programme.desc: A New York, en 1933, le cinéaste Carl Denham engage la jeune actrice Ann Darrow pour son prochain film qui doit se dérouler à Skull Island, à l'est de Sumatra. Inexplorée, l'île abriterait une divinité mystérieuse vénérée par les indigènes. Après un difficile voyage en mer, l'équipe du tournage débarque. Très vite, Ann est enlevé par des cannibales puis offerte en sacrifice à Kong, un singe gigantesque.

programme.title: Madagascar 2 : la grande évasion
programme.desc: Après avoir fui New York et échoué à Madagascar, Alex le lion, Marty le zèbre, Melman la girafe et Gloria l'hippopotame, parviennent à atteindre les plaines d'Afrique grâce à l'aide des pingouins, qui ont réparé l'épave d'un avion. Là, tous ont l'occasion de renouer avec leurs familles éloignées et leurs racines. Marty est comme un poisson dans l'eau, tandis qu'Alex, trop habitué au béton de la Grosse Pomme, ne retrouve pas ses instincts. Quant à la girafe, elle tente par tous les moyens d'avouer son amour à Gloria tandis que celle-ci est courtisée de toutes parts.

programme.title: Shrek 4 : il était une fin
programme.desc: Ayant regagné sa demeure avec femme et enfants, Shrek devrait être heureux. Mais il s'ennuie. Plus personne ne le craint. Lors de la fête d'anniversaire de ses enfants, les tensions s'accumulent pour l'ogre. Les trois petits cochons dévorent le gâteau. Shrek craque et finit par se mettre terriblement en colère. S'éloignant, il rencontre Tracassin, un sorcier qui lui propose un pacte. Contre une signature sur un contrat, il lui offre la possibilité de redevenir un véritable ogre. Shrek accepte… et se réveille dans un monde où plus personne ne le connaît.

programme.title: Hashtag Boomer
programme.sub-title: S1 E5 Famille n'est pas un mot, c'est une phrase

programme.title: Hashtag Boomer
programme.sub-title: S1 E6 TBT, comme ils disent

programme.title: Jackpot
programme.desc: Abandonnée par son fiancé Mason, Joy McNally s'offre une virée à Las Vegas, capitale mondiale du jeu. Là, elle fait la connaissance du séduisant Jack Fuller, qui vient de se faire renvoyer par son patron. Après une nuit arrosée, les deux jeunes gens se réveillent dans le même lit, la bague au doigt et avec un chèque de trois millions de dollars ! De retour à New York, ils se disputent le magot.

programme.title: Tais-toi !
programme.desc: Du fond de son cachot, Ruby, un cerveau du grand banditisme, ne songe qu'à se venger de son ancien patron, un truand qui a fait sauvagement abattre la femme qu'il aimait. Cet individu au caractère fort prépare méticuleusement son évasion. Mais son compagnon de cellule Quentin, un petit braqueur de banques, stupide et gentiment illuminé, s'est mis en tête de se faire la belle avec lui. Il espère même de devenir l'ami de Ruby.

programme.title: Nicky Larson Private Eyes
programme.desc: Au cours d'une de ses missions en plein coeur du quartier animé de Shinjuku, à Tokyo, Nicky Larson est pris dans une fusillade qui sème destruction et confusion aux alentours. Au même moment, Frank Carter, le père d'Iris Woods meurt dans un étrange accident de voiture. La jeune femme, qui se sent depuis menacée, fait appel à l'agence de Nicky et Laura pour assurer sa sécurité. La jeune femme, célèbre top model, emmène les deux détectives à l'une de ses séances de photo. C'est là qu'il croisent le chemin de Christopher King, patron de la florissante société Dominatech. Mais King est également un ancien camarade de collège de Laura.

programme.title: Salaud, on t'aime
programme.desc: Jacques Kaminski, photographe de guerre, s'installe dans les Alpes pour profiter paisiblement de sa retraite. Alors qu'il vient de quitter sa femme, il s'éprend peu à peu de Nathalie Beranger, l'agent immobilier qui lui a trouvé sa maison. Parallèlement, il tente, en vain, de faire venir ses quatre filles, Printemps, Eté, Automne et Hiver. Son meilleur ami et médecin, Frédéric Selman, qui séjourne chez lui, ment aux quatre filles : il affirme que Jacques est atteint d'une grave maladie, espérant les faire venir.

programme.title: Fini de jouer
programme.desc: A 32 ans, Abe Applebaum n'est plus que l'ombre de ce qu'il a été. Détective prodige dès l'âge de 13 ans, le jeune homme a connu une certaine notoriété avant de déchoir sévèrement. Désormais légèrement alcoolique, Abe, 32 ans, vit toujours dans la ville pavillonnaire de Willowbrook, sous le regard navré de ses parents et en est réduit à traiter des affaires mineures, souvent très mal rémunérées. Tout change quand Caroline, une de ses anciennes clientes, vient le voir pour l'aider à résoudre le meurtre de son petit ami, tué de 17 coups de couteaux.

programme.title: Nos futurs
programme.desc: Yann Kerbec mène une existence trop bien rangée, entre un poste de cadre à responsabilités dans une société d'assurances vie et sa vie avec son épouse, Estelle, parfaite. Après sa fête d'anniversaire, il décide de reprendre contact avec Thomas, un camarade de lycée. Au contraire de Yann, Thomas semble n'avoir absolument pas changé. Il est resté le jeune homme amusant et inconséquent qu'il était à l'époque.

programme.title: L'affaire Percy
programme.desc: En 1998, Percy Schmeiser cultivateur de colza depuis des décennies dans le Saskatchewan canadien, reçoit un courrier de la société Monsanto, lui demandant de verser la somme de 19 000 dollars pour l'utilisation de semences brevetées. Percy, qui a toujours refusé d'en utiliser, est convaincu que ces semences ont accidentellement été intégrées à ses cultures par un cultivateur voisin. L'agriculteur, qui refuse de se laisser impressionner par la puissante firme, fait appel à Jackson Weaver, d'un modeste cabinet d'avocats, pour le représenter en justice.

programme.title: Le secret des Kennedy
programme.desc: Frère de John et Bob Kennedy, Ted participe à une régate le week-end du 18 juillet 1969 sur l'île de Chappaquiddick. Après la course, le sénateur du Massachusetts se rend à une fête où sont présents, son cousin et les secrétaires qui ont participé à la campagne présidentielle de Bob Kennedy avant qu'il ne soit assassiné. Avec l'une d'entre-elle, Ted part faire une balade en voiture. Sur la route, il rate un virage et le véhicule tombe dans l'eau. Il en ressort vivant mais pas la secrétaire. Paniqué, Ted préfère prévenir son cousin plutôt que les secours.

programme.title: Les heures sombres
programme.desc: Le 9 mai 1940, alors qu'Adolf Hitler a envahi la Tchécoslovaquie, la Pologne, le Danemark et la Norvège, trois millions de soldats allemands sont stationnés à la frontière belges, prêts à envahir le reste de l'Europe. En Angleterre, le Parlement a perdu confiance en Neville Chamberlain, qui cherchait à préserver la paix à n'importe quel prix, et doit lui trouver, très rapidement, un remplaçant. Un nom semble se démarquer, celui du conservateur Winston Churchill, aux positions radicalement opposées à celles de Chamberlain.

programme.title: Hashtag Boomer
programme.sub-title: S1 E5 Famille n'est pas un mot, c'est une phrase

programme.title: Hashtag Boomer
programme.sub-title: S1 E6 TBT, comme ils disent

programme.title: Shock Wave 2
programme.desc: Poon Shing Fung et Tung Cheuk Man, deux brillants officiers artificiers de la police de Hongkong, sont appelés sur de périlleuses opérations de déminage. A cours de l'une d'entre elles, Shing Fung se trouve pris dans le feu d'une violente explosion, le laissant amputé d'une jambe. Désormais aidé d'une prothèse et déterminé à retrouver sa mobilité, Poon suit un programme sportif intensif, mais quitte la police. Cinq ans plus tard, un jeune homme muni d'une ceinture d'explosif commet un attentat meurtrier dans un immeuble de la ville. Selon toute vraisemblance, il appartient à un mouvement terroriste.

programme.title: Contre-enquête
programme.desc: Hélène Villon, journaliste d'investigation pour le journal « La République », reçoit un message sur son portable de Kevin Lannier. Ce militaire qu'elle avait interviewé à son retour d’Afghanistan dit vouloir lui parler rapidement. Mais quand elle arrive chez lui, il est trop tard. Le jeune homme a été retrouvé mort au pied de son immeuble. Il a chuté du toit. Alors que la police penche pour la thèse du suicide, Hélène, qui connaissait Kevin, décide de mener sa propre enquête. Lors des funérailles, elle aborde la petite amie de Kevin.

programme.title: Zoo
programme.desc: En 1941, à Belfast, alors que l'Irlande, plusieurs fois bombardée, subit les ravages de la guerre, le zoo de Bellevue accueille un nouveau pensionnaire de poids, un éléphanteau. Familier du directeur, monsieur Shawcross, Tom, fils de George Hall, le vétérinaire du zoo, se précipite aussitôt pour rendre visite à l'animal, qu'il baptise bien vite Buster. Mais cette bonne nouvelle est vite assombrie par une autre, quand l'adolescent apprend que son père vient d'être mobilisé et part bientôt au front.

programme.title: Boule & Bill
programme.desc: En France, en 1976, Boule, 9 ans, et ses parents s'arrêtent au chenil lors d'une promenade dominicale et ils découvrent un cocker. Malgré l'opposition du père, le chiot, baptisé Bill, est rapidement adopté. Mais, bien qu'animé de bonnes intentions, il multiplie les catastrophes. Quand la famille doit déménager pour Paris, le père tente, sans succès, d'en profiter pour se débarrasser de lui. C'est le moment où la tortue Caroline intègre la famille. Elle tombe amoureuse de Bill.

programme.title: Populaire
programme.desc: A la fin des années 50, Rose Pamphyle, qui s'est entrainée quelque temps dans l'épicerie familiale, vient d'être embauchée comme secrétaire dans le cabinet d'assurance de Louis Echard. Peu convaincu par ses talents de secrétaire mais épaté par sa rapidité, celui-ci décide d'inscrire la jeune femme à un concours de vitesse dactylographique. Après un premier échec, Louis propose à Rose de venir s'entraîner chez lui en vue de la prochaine compétition.

programme.title: King Kong
programme.desc: A New York, en 1933, le cinéaste Carl Denham engage la jeune actrice Ann Darrow pour son prochain film qui doit se dérouler à Skull Island, à l'est de Sumatra. Inexplorée, l'île abriterait une divinité mystérieuse vénérée par les indigènes. Après un difficile voyage en mer, l'équipe du tournage débarque. Très vite, Ann est enlevé par des cannibales puis offerte en sacrifice à Kong, un singe gigantesque.

programme.title: American Pie
programme.desc: Jim, Oz, Kevin et Finch, quatre copains, décident de perdre leur virginité avant de commencer la fac. Chacun a sa méthode. Jim jette son dévolu sur Nadia, tandis qu'Oz entre dans la chorale pour séduire la prude Heather. Kevin veut convaincre sa petite amie Vicky au moyen d'une «bible» sur les plaisirs du sexe. Finch se fait passer pour un «supermâle». Toutes les filles veulent alors être sa cavalière au bal de la promo.

programme.title: American Pie 2
programme.desc: Jim, Oz, Kevin et Finch, quatre jeunes amis, entendent profiter dignement de leurs vacances. Ils louent une maison sur le bord du lac Michigan. Alors que Nadia doit rejoindre Jim à la fin de l'été, ce dernier retrouve Michelle, une flûtiste délurée auprès de laquelle il a beaucoup de choses à apprendre. Quant à Finch, il se prépare à une nouvelle rencontre avec la mère de Stiffler.

programme.title: Under Pressure
programme.desc: Quand il n'écoute pas dans sa voiture des enregistrements contenant des conseils de professionnels du poker, Gerry, lui-même joueur qui traverse une mauvaise passe, écume les salles de jeu du Sud des Etats-Unis. C'est sur l'une d'entre elles qu'il croise Curtis, un jeune joueur aussi volubile que doué, qui adore raconter nombre d'anecdotes pendant qu'il joue. Quelques heures après leur partie, les deux hommes se retrouvent dans un bar pour échanger sur leurs expériences. Gerry est vite fasciné par le côté imprévisible dans le jeu de Curtis.

programme.title: Hashtag Boomer
programme.sub-title: S1 E5 Famille n'est pas un mot, c'est une phrase

programme.title: Hashtag Boomer
programme.sub-title: S1 E6 TBT, comme ils disent

programme.title: JFK
programme.desc: Le 22 novembre 1963, le président Kennedy est assassiné à Dallas. Le même jour, Lee Harvey Oswald est arrêté et inculpé du meurtre. Le lendemain, il est abattu par Jack Ruby. La commission Warren conclut néanmoins à la culpabilité d'Oswald et à la présence d'un seul tireur. En 1966, les invraisemblances de ce rapport interpellent le procureur Jim Garrison, qui en réfute les conclusions et reprend l'enquête.

programme.title: Fin des programmes
programme.desc: Écrivain égoïste dépourvu d'esprit de famille, Alexandre perd son père, Jacques, foudroyé par une crise cardiaque. Mais Jacques ne disparaît pas vraiment et se manifeste à son fils sous la forme d'un fantôme avec lequel il dialogue en permanence. Tandis que les relations familiales se compliquent, tout le monde s'inquiète des changements de comportements d'Alexandre.

programme.title: Inspecteur Lewis
programme.sub-title: S8 E2 Les lions de Némée

programme.title: Miss Fisher enquête
programme.sub-title: S1 E9 La reine des fleurs

programme.title: Les enquêtes de Murdoch
programme.sub-title: S8 E7 Un loup dans la bergerie

programme.title: Modern Murder : Invisible
programme.desc: Anna Schneider, 29 ans, s'effondre devant son café en pleine rue. Gorniak et Winkler débutent sans tarder l'enquête sur cette mort mystérieuse car elles ont découvert qu'Anna avait récemment porté plainte contre un harceleur inconnu. La victime souffrait également de douleurs physiques à l'origine non identifiée. L'ex-petit ami d'Anna, Nils Klotsche, fait rapidement figure de principal suspect. Groniak est inquiète : comme Anna, qu'elle ne connaissait pas, elle souffre depuis quelque temps de douleurs que son médecin ne parvient pas à expliquer..

programme.title: Fin des programmes
programme.desc: Écrivain égoïste dépourvu d'esprit de famille, Alexandre perd son père, Jacques, foudroyé par une crise cardiaque. Mais Jacques ne disparaît pas vraiment et se manifeste à son fils sous la forme d'un fantôme avec lequel il dialogue en permanence. Tandis que les relations familiales se compliquent, tout le monde s'inquiète des changements de comportements d'Alexandre.

programme.title: Femmes de loi
programme.sub-title: S4 E4 Meurtre à la carte

programme.sub-title: S4 E1 Une vie en lambeaux

programme.sub-title: S4 E2 Les commandos de Sa Majesté

programme.title: Les enquêtes de Murdoch
programme.sub-title: S4 E5 Bons baisers de Paris

programme.title: Keeping Faith
programme.desc: Tandis que la police enquête sur l'effraction qui a eu lieu au domicile de Faith, celle-ci se rend chez Cerys pour en savoir plus sur les relations qu'Evan entretenait avec les Glynn. La relation entre Faith et Steve devient plus intime, ce qui n'échappe pas au capitaine Williams qui demande à l'agent Jones de prendre Faith en filature..

programme.title: Keeping Faith
programme.desc: La voiture d'Evan a été retrouvée sur un lieu connu pour le nombre de suicides élevés qui y sont commis. Mais aucune preuve ne laisse penser à un tel acte. Faith est à nouveau interrogée par la police, et Steve prend des risques pour l'aider..

programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: La découverte stupéfiante qu'a faite Lisa dans la cave de Mark White fait prendre un tour inattendu à l'enquête. Elliott se fait rabrouer par sa collègue qui lui reproche son manque d'investissement dans les investigations. Christina rend visite au directeur du collège que sa fille fréquentait pour lui confier sa détresse. La sincérité d'Ivy est remise en cause par les inspecteurs qui décident de l'arrêter pour entrave à la justice.

programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: Ivy accepte de prendre de gros risques pour permettre à la police de sauver Phoebe. Elle se rend dans le centre commercial où Mark White lui a fixé rendez-vous. De nombreux policiers la surveillent à distance pour assurer sa sécurité. Mais son ravisseur parvient à l'enlever - une nouvelle fois - après avoir libéré Phoebe. La famille Moxam est plongée dans l'horreur.

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 2937900, Title: The Knick, --- Description: The Knick: Created by Jack Amiel, Michael Begler. With André Holland, Clive Owen, Jeremy Bobb, Juliet Rylance. A look at the professional and personal lives of the staff at New York's Knickerbocker Hospital during the early part of the twentieth century." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2937900/","name":"The Knick","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ5NzcyNDc5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDMyOTY5NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A look at the professional and personal lives of the staff at New York's Knickerbocker Hospital during the early part of the twentieth century.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2937900/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Haniwilliam7","dateCreated":"2014-08-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's not just another medical drama","reviewBody":"As a physician, I watched the entire House MD, Scrubs, most of ER and grey's anatomy. As a dedicated reader, I read a lot in medicine history. I'd like to reassure everyone who is afraid of watching another regular medical drama, this show is about medical history with it's bizarre and crazy events (which truly happened allover the course of medicine History), but in the same time it's a perfectly crafted piece of art from attention to small details to acting, writing, camera angels, sound tract and of course directing by Soderbergh.

Dr. John Thackery is a character built on 1900s Dr. William Stewart Halsted who is considered the greatest physician of the whole Johns Hopkins group, also Throughout his professional life, he was addicted to cocaine and later to morphine, which were not illegal during that time. The beauty about Thackery character is that it's a true character with his addiction and the predicted mood changes (even if there is some alteration, the character frame still the same, not like the case of G. House who was clearly a fictional character).

I don't want to go in details about the technical elements of the show, but one look over Steven Soderbergh's traffic, Erin Brockovich or even Ocean's eleven will be more than enough to understand that you are facing a spectacular show which has more and more to offer with each new episode (no wonder it was renewed for a second season before airing the first one).

The Knick is a too much sophisticated show to be compared with other shows from the same genre and IMO it shouldn't be compared with them at all. My advice to every one: see the first season now because if you're a TV person you will end up watching it anyway.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":46356,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.5,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2014-08-08","keywords":"1900s,surgeon,doctor,hospital,surgery","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2428245/","name":"André Holland","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654110/","name":"Clive Owen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2205243/","name":"Jeremy Bobb"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017525/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0024856/","name":"Jack Amiel","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0066764/","name":"Michael Begler"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 2 Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2103030553","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQzMDk1OTkxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjc5MjEwNzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQzMDk1OTkxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjc5MjEwNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch the Season 2 trailer for "The Knick"."</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Elementary
Elementary
Elementary
programme.sub-title: S7 E12 S7 E12 Reichenbach fällt
programme.desc:
Elementary: Created by Robert Doherty. With Jonny Lee Miller, Lucy Liu, Aidan Quinn, Jon Michael Hill. A modern take on the cases of Sherlock Holmes, with the detective now living in New York City." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2191671/","name":"Elementary","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDEyN2U1YTItNDY1Zi00YjljLWI5YzItNWU3YWViYjhiZTgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A modern take on the cases of Sherlock Holmes, with the detective now living in New York City.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2191671/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"William_G"},"dateCreated":"2013-12-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"A different spin on a classic, A great show on its own merits","reviewBody":"Like many people, I love BBC's Sherlock and overlooked Elementary for many reasons. I recently decided to give it a chance and was pleasantly surprised to say the least. First off, don't make the same mistake I did and dismiss it for some of the rather odd sounding changes, it's intended to be a different spin on the classic and does so very well.

Jonny Lee Miller plays a great Sherlock. He's more human and flawed, where the original Sherlock was almost cartoonishly strong at times, but he still has the same confident eccentric brilliance that makes Sherlock Holmes so interesting. He's a recovering addict aided by Sober Companion Watson, a modern politically correct spin on classic Holmes drug use that feels tacked on and out of place at times, but helps drive the character development of both Holmes and Watson.

The new Watson angle was a big factor in what made me pass on the show at first. In addition to the Sober Companion job, it sounded very generic Hollywoody to find an excuse to shoehorn in a pretty female co-star, but Lucy Liu is very good in her role. She doesn't play a shallow sexy distraction from the story, rather just a different sex portraying the same inquisitive, intelligent, adventurous companion that Watson should be. And (as far as I am in the series - fingers crossed) there's no pointless romantic subplots between her and Sherlock, just a straight played female Watson. Hats off to Lucy Liu for making a tough character change that I was prepared to dislike so likable and real.

The best part of the show however is the writing. Writing good mysteries is a fine line to walk. You can either give too little information and blindside the viewer, leaving them feeling shut out and just along for the ride, or too much information delivered too overtly and ruin the fun of following step in step with the details. The truth has to be there somewhere for you to see but not too soon. Elementary manages to walk that line very well. There have been times when something was too obvious or too unpredictable, but much more often the truth is cleverly masked until just the right time - a little before it's revealed, if you're sharp. 

I went into this series with low expectations but very quickly fell in love with it. Whether you like the different spin on Arthur Conan Doyle's characters or not, Elementary does mystery right, and it's worth a watch based on that alone.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":105939,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2012-09-27","keywords":"new york city detective,british in america,detective,modernized setting,companionship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001538/","name":"Jonny Lee Miller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005154/","name":"Lucy Liu"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001644/","name":"Aidan Quinn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0395934/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280908/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1201266/","name":"Robert Doherty"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2393551385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA1MDgwOTE5OTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQ0NTU2MTcx._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA1MDgwOTE5OTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQ0NTU2MTcx._V1_.jpg","description":"See what's in store in season 4 of "Elemetary.""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.category: Crime, Drama, Mystery, Crime, Drama, Mystery
programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 2191671, Title: Elementary, --- Description: Elementary: Created by Robert Doherty. With Jonny Lee Miller, Lucy Liu, Aidan Quinn, Jon Michael Hill. A modern take on the cases of Sherlock Holmes, with the detective now living in New York City." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2191671/","name":"Elementary","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDEyN2U1YTItNDY1Zi00YjljLWI5YzItNWU3YWViYjhiZTgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A modern take on the cases of Sherlock Holmes, with the detective now living in New York City.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2191671/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"William_G","dateCreated":"2013-12-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"A different spin on a classic, A great show on its own merits","reviewBody":"Like many people, I love BBC's Sherlock and overlooked Elementary for many reasons. I recently decided to give it a chance and was pleasantly surprised to say the least. First off, don't make the same mistake I did and dismiss it for some of the rather odd sounding changes, it's intended to be a different spin on the classic and does so very well.

Jonny Lee Miller plays a great Sherlock. He's more human and flawed, where the original Sherlock was almost cartoonishly strong at times, but he still has the same confident eccentric brilliance that makes Sherlock Holmes so interesting. He's a recovering addict aided by Sober Companion Watson, a modern politically correct spin on classic Holmes drug use that feels tacked on and out of place at times, but helps drive the character development of both Holmes and Watson.

The new Watson angle was a big factor in what made me pass on the show at first. In addition to the Sober Companion job, it sounded very generic Hollywoody to find an excuse to shoehorn in a pretty female co-star, but Lucy Liu is very good in her role. She doesn't play a shallow sexy distraction from the story, rather just a different sex portraying the same inquisitive, intelligent, adventurous companion that Watson should be. And (as far as I am in the series - fingers crossed) there's no pointless romantic subplots between her and Sherlock, just a straight played female Watson. Hats off to Lucy Liu for making a tough character change that I was prepared to dislike so likable and real.

The best part of the show however is the writing. Writing good mysteries is a fine line to walk. You can either give too little information and blindside the viewer, leaving them feeling shut out and just along for the ride, or too much information delivered too overtly and ruin the fun of following step in step with the details. The truth has to be there somewhere for you to see but not too soon. Elementary manages to walk that line very well. There have been times when something was too obvious or too unpredictable, but much more often the truth is cleverly masked until just the right time - a little before it's revealed, if you're sharp. 

I went into this series with low expectations but very quickly fell in love with it. IMDb data; ttnr: 2191671, Title: Elementary, --- Description: Elementary: Created by Robert Doherty. With Jonny Lee Miller, Lucy Liu, Aidan Quinn, Jon Michael Hill. A modern take on the cases of Sherlock Holmes, with the detective now living in New York City." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2191671/","name":"Elementary","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDEyN2U1YTItNDY1Zi00YjljLWI5YzItNWU3YWViYjhiZTgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A modern take on the cases of Sherlock Holmes, with the detective now living in New York City.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2191671/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"William_G","dateCreated":"2013-12-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"A different spin on a classic, A great show on its own merits","reviewBody":"Like many people, I love BBC's Sherlock and overlooked Elementary for many reasons. I recently decided to give it a chance and was pleasantly surprised to say the least. First off, don't make the same mistake I did and dismiss it for some of the rather odd sounding changes, it's intended to be a different spin on the classic and does so very well.

Jonny Lee Miller plays a great Sherlock. He's more human and flawed, where the original Sherlock was almost cartoonishly strong at times, but he still has the same confident eccentric brilliance that makes Sherlock Holmes so interesting. He's a recovering addict aided by Sober Companion Watson, a modern politically correct spin on classic Holmes drug use that feels tacked on and out of place at times, but helps drive the character development of both Holmes and Watson.

The new Watson angle was a big factor in what made me pass on the show at first. In addition to the Sober Companion job, it sounded very generic Hollywoody to find an excuse to shoehorn in a pretty female co-star, but Lucy Liu is very good in her role. She doesn't play a shallow sexy distraction from the story, rather just a different sex portraying the same inquisitive, intelligent, adventurous companion that Watson should be. And (as far as I am in the series - fingers crossed) there's no pointless romantic subplots between her and Sherlock, just a straight played female Watson. Hats off to Lucy Liu for making a tough character change that I was prepared to dislike so likable and real.

The best part of the show however is the writing. Writing good mysteries is a fine line to walk. You can either give too little information and blindside the viewer, leaving them feeling shut out and just along for the ride, or too much information delivered too overtly and ruin the fun of following step in step with the details. The truth has to be there somewhere for you to see but not too soon. Elementary manages to walk that line very well. There have been times when something was too obvious or too unpredictable, but much more often the truth is cleverly masked until just the right time - a little before it's revealed, if you're sharp. 

I went into this series with low expectations but very quickly fell in love with it. Whether you like the different spin on Arthur Conan Doyle's characters or not, Elementary does mystery right, and it's worth a watch based on that alone.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":105939,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2012-09-27","keywords":"new york city detective,british in america,detective,modernized setting,companionship","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001538/","name":"Jonny Lee Miller","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005154/","name":"Lucy Liu","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001644/","name":"Aidan Quinn"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0395934/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280908/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1201266/","name":"Robert Doherty"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2393551385","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA1MDgwOTE5OTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQ0NTU2MTcx._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA1MDgwOTE5OTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQ0NTU2MTcx._V1_.jpg","description":"See what's in store in season 4 of "Elemetary.""</script><metacontent="

Telepathic waitress Sookie Stackhouse encounters a strange new supernatural world when she meets the mysterious Bill Compton, a southern Louisiana gentleman and vampire." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0844441/","name":"True Blood","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDVjZDQ2N2MtMzMxYy00ZjliLTg5YjAtNjk1OTUwYjVjNWQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzA5NjUyNjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Telepathic waitress Sookie Stackhouse encounters a strange new supernatural world when she meets the mysterious Bill Compton, a southern Louisiana gentleman and vampire.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0844441/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"skip-98756"},"dateCreated":"2020-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Absolutely Superb and Unique Entry in this Genre!","reviewBody":"I just finished watching this amazing vampire series once again..I saw it when it 1st came out and hadnt watched it for a long time..I'd forgotton how it ended and alot of it was like watching for the first time again. This is some Very unique writing and not like any vampire,werewolf,witch show that you have ever seen before..It takes the very difficult path of mixing horror,gore,sexuality, intensity, drama,humor and satire all in one show and it does it extremely well! You feel a bond with each of the characters and there is a great deal of character development over the seasons, so much so that some of the characters become almost polar opposites of what they were when they were 1st introduced..Another fascinating twist is the Bizzare but also Wonderful change in the writing that occurs in the last season..its So Different that you wonder what the heck happenned! The whole tone of the show changes and yes this will disrupt Alot of viewers who expect a continuity of theme thru the show till its end....But....The change ,though radical, is also wonderful..I'd say there is Less humor, less satire, more Intensity, More seriousness in each actors acting which leads to a more dramatic feeling..The gore is still there but its Not as funny, its serious, its intense, and its heart breaking for so many of the characters and they all act it out so well.. Overall, that last season was like watching a Different show but it was Every bit as interesting and entertaining...Now thats something you Dont see very often! I love this show...Sexy,smart, dramatic, satirical and crazy funny at time, heartbreaking at others...What more could you ask of Any show in Any genre? The Final episode covers the full gamut of emotions and wraps things up in a beautiful ending that would bring a tear and a smile to anyone... highly recommended!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":236826,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-09-07","keywords":"human vampire relationship,vampire,witch,shapeshifter,bare breasts","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001593/","name":"Anna Paquin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0610459/","name":"Stephen Moyer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0870794/","name":"Sam Trammell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0247237/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008693/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0050332/","name":"Alan Ball"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 7","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1494920473","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTgyNDcxMDkwOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDY4MjM4MTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTgyNDcxMDkwOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDY4MjM4MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch the full trailer for HBO's original series "True Blood"."}}</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 0844441, Title: True Blood, --- Description: True Blood: Created by Alan Ball. With Anna Paquin, Stephen Moyer, Sam Trammell, Ryan Kwanten. Telepathic waitress Sookie Stackhouse encounters a strange new supernatural world when she meets the mysterious Bill Compton, a southern Louisiana gentleman and vampire." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0844441/","name":"True Blood","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDVjZDQ2N2MtMzMxYy00ZjliLTg5YjAtNjk1OTUwYjVjNWQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzA5NjUyNjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Telepathic waitress Sookie Stackhouse encounters a strange new supernatural world when she meets the mysterious Bill Compton, a southern Louisiana gentleman and vampire.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0844441/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"skip-98756","dateCreated":"2020-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Absolutely Superb and Unique Entry in this Genre!","reviewBody":"I just finished watching this amazing vampire series once again..I saw it when it 1st came out and hadnt watched it for a long time..I'd forgotton how it ended and alot of it was like watching for the first time again. This is some Very unique writing and not like any vampire,werewolf,witch show that you have ever seen before..It takes the very difficult path of mixing horror,gore,sexuality, intensity, drama,humor and satire all in one show and it does it extremely well! You feel a bond with each of the characters and there is a great deal of character development over the seasons, so much so that some of the characters become almost polar opposites of what they were when they were 1st introduced..Another fascinating twist is the Bizzare but also Wonderful change in the writing that occurs in the last season..its So Different that you wonder what the heck happenned! The whole tone of the show changes and yes this will disrupt Alot of viewers who expect a continuity of theme thru the show till its end....But....The change ,though radical, is also wonderful..I'd say there is Less humor, less satire, more Intensity, More seriousness in each actors acting which leads to a more dramatic feeling..The gore is still there but its Not as funny, its serious, its intense, and its heart breaking for so many of the characters and they all act it out so well.. Overall, that last season was like watching a Different show but it was Every bit as interesting and entertaining...Now thats something you Dont see very often! I love this show...Sexy,smart, dramatic, satirical and crazy funny at time, heartbreaking at others...What more could you ask of Any show in Any genre? The Final episode covers the full gamut of emotions and wraps things up in a beautiful ending that would bring a tear and a smile to anyone... highly recommended!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":236826,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-09-07","keywords":"human vampire relationship,vampire,witch,shapeshifter,bare breasts","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001593/","name":"Anna Paquin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0610459/","name":"Stephen Moyer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0870794/","name":"Sam Trammell"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0247237/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008693/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0050332/","name":"Alan Ball"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 7","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1494920473","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTgyNDcxMDkwOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDY4MjM4MTE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTgyNDcxMDkwOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDY4MjM4MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch the full trailer for HBO's original series "True Blood"."</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 0248654, Title: Six Feet Under, --- Description: Six Feet Under: Created by Alan Ball. With Peter Krause, Michael C. Hall, Frances Conroy, Lauren Ambrose. A chronicle of the lives of a dysfunctional family who run an independent funeral home in Los Angeles." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0248654/","name":"Six Feet Under","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FmMjg0Y2YtYmMyYi00MTBjLTllYzMtN2VjYzRhOTVmNWRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDIzMzcwNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A chronicle of the lives of a dysfunctional family who run an independent funeral home in Los Angeles.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0248654/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"alexkolokotronis","dateCreated":"2009-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"This Show Does The Impossible","reviewBody":"When using superlatives with this show it is totally fair. This show does something all other movies, shows, etc cannot do: it can safely apply any genre and still function as a deep and very entertaining show. As everybody episode goes by the show only becomes more addictive. It taps into almost every aspect of life. Every emotion is shown; love, hate, forgiveness, triumph and the list goes on and on. In fact this show depicts life the most realistically. The strangeness and peculiarity of the many themes perfectly displays the confusion in life and how it affects us. The show displays confusion in the clearest way making it almost impossible not to some how relate to the characters in the show. Not to mention also the series ends on one finest note you will ever see not just satisfying the viewer but taking the show to a level far and above anything else I have ever seen before. This show does the impossible twice over.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":127784,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.7,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2001-06-03","keywords":"funeral home,daydream,talking to the dead,husband wife relationship,boyfriend girlfriend relationship","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0470244/","name":"Peter Krause","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0355910/","name":"Michael C. Hall","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0175814/","name":"Frances Conroy"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008693/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010714/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030266/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0050332/","name":"Alan Ball"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Six Feet Under: The Complete Second Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2609381657","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGM0ZmM3MDAtODc0MC00NjljLTk3OTEtNGM5MzYxOTA1ZDYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGM0ZmM3MDAtODc0MC00NjljLTk3OTEtNGM5MzYxOTA1ZDYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Treme
Treme
Treme
programme.sub-title: S1 E10 S1 E10 I'll Fly Away
programme.desc:
Treme: Created by Eric Ellis Overmyer, David Simon. With Khandi Alexander, Rob Brown, Kim Dickens, Melissa Leo. Life after Hurricane Katrina as the residents of New Orleans try to rebuild their lives, their homes, and their unique culture in the aftermath of one of the worst natural disasters in the USA." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1279972/","name":"Treme","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjg4ZGZkYjEtYTZhMy00YjU1LTg1MTYtNDlmNTAwYTA0M2NmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTE1NjY5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Life after Hurricane Katrina as the residents of New Orleans try to rebuild their lives, their homes, and their unique culture in the aftermath of one of the worst natural disasters in the USA.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1279972/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bilko-1"},"dateCreated":"2010-04-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"A major artistic achievement from David Simon","reviewBody":"My first impression, from watching episode one, was that the writing did not have the flow of "The Wire" it was trying too hard to register the many characters and to quickly tick off the various "types" that make up New Orleans society. Bunk and Freeman were too firmly placed in my memory for me to make the leap to Antoine and Albert. As for the Steve Zahn character, I instantly took a dislike to him and found him unrealistic in the extreme.

By the time we had reached the scene with the Big Chief emerging from the dark, I had become hooked. The characters started to make sense. The generous helping of musical scenes produced what must be the finest portrayal of live music and musicians I have ever seen. I could not wait to catch episode two.

I have now watched the first two episodes twice and all my first impressions have been blown away. Once you get to know the characters and can watch their introduction again, things start to make sense. Steve Zahn? What a brilliant comic creation. Just watch the intro to episode two, his creeping around Elvis Costello, his first day on the job. Absolutely first rate, The shocking introduction of violence, suddenly alters ones perceptions of a major character. Bunk, still lingers in the memory, but Antoine's blowing is going to change all that. I was not familiar with Khandi Alexander, but am now a major fan. Her performance is charismatic in the extreme.

I know that this series is not going to be to everyone's liking, but then neither is Shakespeare or Dickens. However, for those who enjoy a multi-faceted piece of work that can examine society in minute detail whilst never failing to entertain, this will surely rank as a major piece of American art.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14232,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2010-04-11","keywords":"21st century,post hurricane katrina,reference to hurricane katrina,radio station,alternative music","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0018554/","name":"Khandi Alexander"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0114532/","name":"Rob Brown"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0225332/","name":"Kim Dickens"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019588/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0284741/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0653899/","name":"Eric Ellis Overmyer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800108/","name":"David Simon"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season Four Preview","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4226458905","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDAyMDM5NTg2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzI0NDYyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDAyMDM5NTg2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzI0NDYyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch the season four trailer for "Treme"!"}}</script><metacontent="

Bunk, still lingers in the memory, but Antoine's blowing is going to change all that. I was not familiar with Khandi Alexander, but am now a major fan. Her performance is charismatic in the extreme.

I know that this series is not going to be to everyone's liking, but then neither is Shakespeare or Dickens. However, for those who enjoy a multi-faceted piece of work that can examine society in minute detail whilst never failing to entertain, this will surely rank as a major piece of American art.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14232,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2010-04-11","keywords":"21st century,post hurricane katrina,reference to hurricane katrina,radio station,alternative music","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0018554/","name":"Khandi Alexander","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0114532/","name":"Rob Brown","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0225332/","name":"Kim Dickens"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019588/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0284741/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0653899/","name":"Eric Ellis Overmyer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800108/","name":"David Simon"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season Four Preview","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4226458905","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDAyMDM5NTg2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzI0NDYyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDAyMDM5NTg2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzI0NDYyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch the season four trailer for "Treme"!"</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1279972, Title: Treme, --- Description: Treme: Created by Eric Ellis Overmyer, David Simon. With Khandi Alexander, Rob Brown, Kim Dickens, Melissa Leo. Life after Hurricane Katrina as the residents of New Orleans try to rebuild their lives, their homes, and their unique culture in the aftermath of one of the worst natural disasters in the USA." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1279972/","name":"Treme","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjg4ZGZkYjEtYTZhMy00YjU1LTg1MTYtNDlmNTAwYTA0M2NmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTE1NjY5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Life after Hurricane Katrina as the residents of New Orleans try to rebuild their lives, their homes, and their unique culture in the aftermath of one of the worst natural disasters in the USA.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1279972/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"bilko-1","dateCreated":"2010-04-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"A major artistic achievement from David Simon","reviewBody":"My first impression, from watching episode one, was that the writing did not have the flow of "The Wire" it was trying too hard to register the many characters and to quickly tick off the various "types" that make up New Orleans society. Bunk and Freeman were too firmly placed in my memory for me to make the leap to Antoine and Albert. As for the Steve Zahn character, I instantly took a dislike to him and found him unrealistic in the extreme.

By the time we had reached the scene with the Big Chief emerging from the dark, I had become hooked. The characters started to make sense. The generous helping of musical scenes produced what must be the finest portrayal of live music and musicians I have ever seen. I could not wait to catch episode two.

I have now watched the first two episodes twice and all my first impressions have been blown away. Once you get to know the characters and can watch their introduction again, things start to make sense. Steve Zahn? What a brilliant comic creation. Just watch the intro to episode two, his creeping around Elvis Costello, his first day on the job. Absolutely first rate, The shocking introduction of violence, suddenly alters ones perceptions of a major character. Bunk, still lingers in the memory, but Antoine's blowing is going to change all that. I was not familiar with Khandi Alexander, but am now a major fan. Her performance is charismatic in the extreme.

I know that this series is not going to be to everyone's liking, but then neither is Shakespeare or Dickens. However, for those who enjoy a multi-faceted piece of work that can examine society in minute detail whilst never failing to entertain, this will surely rank as a major piece of American art.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14232,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2010-04-11","keywords":"21st century,post hurricane katrina,reference to hurricane katrina,radio station,alternative music","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0018554/","name":"Khandi Alexander","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0114532/","name":"Rob Brown","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0225332/","name":"Kim Dickens"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019588/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0284741/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0653899/","name":"Eric Ellis Overmyer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800108/","name":"David Simon"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season Four Preview","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4226458905","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDAyMDM5NTg2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzI0NDYyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDAyMDM5NTg2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzI0NDYyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch the season four trailer for "Treme"!"</script><metacontent="

Elementary
programme.sub-title: S7 E13 S7 E13 Ihre Abschiedsvorstellung
programme.desc:
Elementary: Created by Robert Doherty. With Jonny Lee Miller, Lucy Liu, Aidan Quinn, Jon Michael Hill. A modern take on the cases of Sherlock Holmes, with the detective now living in New York City." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2191671/","name":"Elementary","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDEyN2U1YTItNDY1Zi00YjljLWI5YzItNWU3YWViYjhiZTgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A modern take on the cases of Sherlock Holmes, with the detective now living in New York City.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2191671/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"William_G"},"dateCreated":"2013-12-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"A different spin on a classic, A great show on its own merits","reviewBody":"Like many people, I love BBC's Sherlock and overlooked Elementary for many reasons. I recently decided to give it a chance and was pleasantly surprised to say the least. First off, don't make the same mistake I did and dismiss it for some of the rather odd sounding changes, it's intended to be a different spin on the classic and does so very well.

Jonny Lee Miller plays a great Sherlock. He's more human and flawed, where the original Sherlock was almost cartoonishly strong at times, but he still has the same confident eccentric brilliance that makes Sherlock Holmes so interesting. He's a recovering addict aided by Sober Companion Watson, a modern politically correct spin on classic Holmes drug use that feels tacked on and out of place at times, but helps drive the character development of both Holmes and Watson.

The new Watson angle was a big factor in what made me pass on the show at first. In addition to the Sober Companion job, it sounded very generic Hollywoody to find an excuse to shoehorn in a pretty female co-star, but Lucy Liu is very good in her role. She doesn't play a shallow sexy distraction from the story, rather just a different sex portraying the same inquisitive, intelligent, adventurous companion that Watson should be. And (as far as I am in the series - fingers crossed) there's no pointless romantic subplots between her and Sherlock, just a straight played female Watson. Hats off to Lucy Liu for making a tough character change that I was prepared to dislike so likable and real.

The best part of the show however is the writing. Writing good mysteries is a fine line to walk. You can either give too little information and blindside the viewer, leaving them feeling shut out and just along for the ride, or too much information delivered too overtly and ruin the fun of following step in step with the details. The truth has to be there somewhere for you to see but not too soon. Elementary manages to walk that line very well. There have been times when something was too obvious or too unpredictable, but much more often the truth is cleverly masked until just the right time - a little before it's revealed, if you're sharp. 

I went into this series with low expectations but very quickly fell in love with it. Whether you like the different spin on Arthur Conan Doyle's characters or not, Elementary does mystery right, and it's worth a watch based on that alone.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":105939,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2012-09-27","keywords":"new york city detective,british in america,detective,modernized setting,companionship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001538/","name":"Jonny Lee Miller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005154/","name":"Lucy Liu"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001644/","name":"Aidan Quinn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0395934/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280908/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1201266/","name":"Robert Doherty"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2393551385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA1MDgwOTE5OTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQ0NTU2MTcx._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA1MDgwOTE5OTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQ0NTU2MTcx._V1_.jpg","description":"See what's in store in season 4 of "Elemetary.""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 2191671, Title: Elementary, --- Description: Elementary: Created by Robert Doherty. With Jonny Lee Miller, Lucy Liu, Aidan Quinn, Jon Michael Hill. A modern take on the cases of Sherlock Holmes, with the detective now living in New York City." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2191671/","name":"Elementary","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDEyN2U1YTItNDY1Zi00YjljLWI5YzItNWU3YWViYjhiZTgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A modern take on the cases of Sherlock Holmes, with the detective now living in New York City.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2191671/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"William_G","dateCreated":"2013-12-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"A different spin on a classic, A great show on its own merits","reviewBody":"Like many people, I love BBC's Sherlock and overlooked Elementary for many reasons. I recently decided to give it a chance and was pleasantly surprised to say the least. First off, don't make the same mistake I did and dismiss it for some of the rather odd sounding changes, it's intended to be a different spin on the classic and does so very well.

Jonny Lee Miller plays a great Sherlock. He's more human and flawed, where the original Sherlock was almost cartoonishly strong at times, but he still has the same confident eccentric brilliance that makes Sherlock Holmes so interesting. He's a recovering addict aided by Sober Companion Watson, a modern politically correct spin on classic Holmes drug use that feels tacked on and out of place at times, but helps drive the character development of both Holmes and Watson.

The new Watson angle was a big factor in what made me pass on the show at first. In addition to the Sober Companion job, it sounded very generic Hollywoody to find an excuse to shoehorn in a pretty female co-star, but Lucy Liu is very good in her role. She doesn't play a shallow sexy distraction from the story, rather just a different sex portraying the same inquisitive, intelligent, adventurous companion that Watson should be. And (as far as I am in the series - fingers crossed) there's no pointless romantic subplots between her and Sherlock, just a straight played female Watson. Hats off to Lucy Liu for making a tough character change that I was prepared to dislike so likable and real.

The best part of the show however is the writing. Writing good mysteries is a fine line to walk. You can either give too little information and blindside the viewer, leaving them feeling shut out and just along for the ride, or too much information delivered too overtly and ruin the fun of following step in step with the details. The truth has to be there somewhere for you to see but not too soon. Elementary manages to walk that line very well. There have been times when something was too obvious or too unpredictable, but much more often the truth is cleverly masked until just the right time - a little before it's revealed, if you're sharp. 

I went into this series with low expectations but very quickly fell in love with it. Whether you like the different spin on Arthur Conan Doyle's characters or not, Elementary does mystery right, and it's worth a watch based on that alone.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":105939,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2012-09-27","keywords":"new york city detective,british in america,detective,modernized setting,companionship","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001538/","name":"Jonny Lee Miller","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005154/","name":"Lucy Liu","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001644/","name":"Aidan Quinn"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0395934/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280908/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1201266/","name":"Robert Doherty"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2393551385","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA1MDgwOTE5OTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQ0NTU2MTcx._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA1MDgwOTE5OTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQ0NTU2MTcx._V1_.jpg","description":"See what's in store in season 4 of "Elemetary.""</script><metacontent="

He's a recovering addict aided by Sober Companion Watson, a modern politically correct spin on classic Holmes drug use that feels tacked on and out of place at times, but helps drive the character development of both Holmes and Watson.

The new Watson angle was a big factor in what made me pass on the show at first. In addition to the Sober Companion job, it sounded very generic Hollywoody to find an excuse to shoehorn in a pretty female co-star, but Lucy Liu is very good in her role. She doesn't play a shallow sexy distraction from the story, rather just a different sex portraying the same inquisitive, intelligent, adventurous companion that Watson should be. And (as far as I am in the series - fingers crossed) there's no pointless romantic subplots between her and Sherlock, just a straight played female Watson. Hats off to Lucy Liu for making a tough character change that I was prepared to dislike so likable and real.

The best part of the show however is the writing. Writing good mysteries is a fine line to walk. You can either give too little information and blindside the viewer, leaving them feeling shut out and just along for the ride, or too much information delivered too overtly and ruin the fun of following step in step with the details. The truth has to be there somewhere for you to see but not too soon. Elementary manages to walk that line very well. There have been times when something was too obvious or too unpredictable, but much more often the truth is cleverly masked until just the right time - a little before it's revealed, if you're sharp. 

I went into this series with low expectations but very quickly fell in love with it. Whether you like the different spin on Arthur Conan Doyle's characters or not, Elementary does mystery right, and it's worth a watch based on that alone.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":105939,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2012-09-27","keywords":"new york city detective,british in america,detective,modernized setting,companionship","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001538/","name":"Jonny Lee Miller","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005154/","name":"Lucy Liu","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001644/","name":"Aidan Quinn"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0395934/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280908/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1201266/","name":"Robert Doherty"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2393551385","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA1MDgwOTE5OTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQ0NTU2MTcx._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA1MDgwOTE5OTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQ0NTU2MTcx._V1_.jpg","description":"See what's in store in season 4 of "Elemetary.""</script><metacontent="

programme.title: All the Way
Der lange Weg
programme.desc:
All the Way: Directed by Jay Roach. With Bryan Cranston, Anthony Mackie, Melissa Leo, Frank Langella. Lyndon B. Johnson becomes the President of the United States in the chaotic aftermath of John F. Kennedy's assassination, and spends his first year in office fighting to pass the Civil Rights Act." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3791216/","name":"All the Way","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzUwMTRmMjYtNjI0ZC00Mzc3LTgyZGQtZTA5OTg5ZmVkZDMxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDQzMDg4Nzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lyndon B. Johnson becomes the President of the United States in the chaotic aftermath of John F. Kennedy's assassination, and spends his first year in office fighting to pass the Civil Rights Act.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3791216/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"secondtake"},"dateCreated":"2016-05-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cranston is great, and the events are even greater....","reviewBody":"All the Way

An impressive cast, centered around the LBJ actor Bryan Cranston, keeps the historical facts alive and relevant.

We often forget Johnson the president between Kennedy and Nixon. He was the most responsible for Vietnam, but also for a huge range of social programs that really make him the ultimate big government guy since Roosevelt. But important programs like Medicare and social legislation like the Civil Rights Act and the Voting Act. Seeing him struggle to make it happen is a kind of poker game, and he does it with famously Johnson candor and humor.

There's no getting around the fact that these are facts. There are no dramatic surprises here (so it's like seeing a movie the second time). But it's a good movie—one that you can see a second time and get a lot from it. There are weak points (some miscast figures like, unfortunately, Martin Luther King Jr. who is played by Anthony Mackie), but overall the drama of the events is kept intense and pertinent.

And Cranston is sublime. If you know him from "Breaking Bad" you will surprised by his depth here. See him, at least. And Johnson, too.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13876,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2016-05-21","keywords":"j. edgar hoover character,lyndon b. johnson character,jacqueline kennedy character,dallas texas,year 1963","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3039999001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzMwMjk5MzI3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDYwODY5ODE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzMwMjk5MzI3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDYwODY5ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lyndon B. Johnson (Bryan Cranston) becomes the President of the United States in the chaotic aftermath of JFK's assassination and spends his first year in office to quickly pass the Civil Rights Act."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186505/","name":"Bryan Cranston"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1107001/","name":"Anthony Mackie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0502425/","name":"Melissa Leo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005366/","name":"Jay Roach"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005861/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0490948/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0770938/","name":"Robert Schenkkan"}],"duration":"PT2H12M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Strangers: Prey at Night
The Strangers: Opfernacht
programme.desc:
The Strangers: Prey at Night: Directed by Johannes Roberts. With Christina Hendricks, Martin Henderson, Bailee Madison, Lewis Pullman. A family of four staying at a secluded mobile home park for the night are stalked and then hunted by three masked psychopaths." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1285009/","name":"The Strangers: Prey at Night","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY1OTIwODgzMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzUyMDgzNDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A family of four staying at a secluded mobile home park for the night are stalked and then hunted by three masked psychopaths.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1285009/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"claudio_carvalho"},"dateCreated":"2018-06-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Unoriginal and Stupid Slasher","reviewBody":""The Strangers: Prey at Night" is another unoriginal and stupid slasher, with a storyline that is on the shelf of any mediocre screenwriter ready to be reprocessed and usually said "based on true events". The most impressive is that even this type of storyline is able to produce good and scary low-budget slashers, such as the French-Romanian "Ils" ("Them" - 2006) or the Austrian "Funny Games" (1997) by Michael Haneke. Both films are tense and make the viewer nervous with the frightening atmospheres. The cruelty in "Funny Games" is impressively cold and therefore horrifying.

In "The Strangers: Prey at Night", there is no character development or motive and the situations are stupid with many cliches. The family splits in the beginning, aware that their relatives have been slaughtered, instead of immediately driving to the police station. The father sees what happened to his wife, but does not shoot the killer. The survivors have many chances to leave the camping area and to possess weapon, but are surprised in the most clichés situations. The police officer has his throat cut in another typical clichés, when the good girl believes that is safe. Advice when most needed is least heeded, but do not spend your time watching this movie. There are much better options in the genre. My vote is three.
