programme.title: Men in Black
MIB – Men In Black
programme.desc: Men in Black: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Linda Fiorentino, Vincent D'Onofrio. A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119654/","name":"Men in Black","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTlhYTVkMDktYzIyNC00NzlkLTlmN2ItOGEyMWQ4OTA2NDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119654/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"crowrobot"},"dateCreated":"2004-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the best sci-fi comedies ever made.","reviewBody":"As my one line summary says, this is one of the best sci-fi comedies ever made, next to the classic Ghostbusters and the highly underrated Evolution. This movie has action, comedy, and some of the best special effects in the last ten years. Rick Baker, Hollywood's resident 'creature man', as I like to call him, has made such a wide variety of aliens. There's the first alien we see, Mikey; there's the Worm Guys; and the villanous Bug. But there are many others, such as Frank the Pug and the twins. The squid baby is pretty neat. Tommy Lee Jones and Will Smith have an undeniable chemistry together, which repeats itself in the sequel. Linda Fiorentino is also good as the leading lady, and veteran actor Rip Torn is gruff as the head of MIB, Zed. Vincent D'Onofrio is also pretty good. My favorite line: "No, ma'am. We at the FBI do not have a sense of humor that we are aware of." All in all, two thumbs up, baby!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":540588,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1997-07-02","keywords":"alien,pantyhose,superhero,flying saucer,laser gun","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1466737177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A streetwise NYPD detective joins a secret organization that polices extraterrestrial affairs on Earth."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000400/","name":"Linda Fiorentino"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004412/","name":"Ed Solomon"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black II
Men in Black 2
programme.desc:
Men in Black II: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Rip Torn, Lara Flynn Boyle. Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120912/","name":"Men in Black II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxNDA0NTMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDE2NzY2._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120912/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Michael_Elliott"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Sequel About Money","reviewBody":"Men in Black II (2002)

* 1/2 (out of 4) 

Boring and bland sequel has Earth coming under attack from a dangerous alien (Lara Flynn Boyle) so Agent Jay (Will Smith) must bring Agent Kay (Tommy Lee Jones) out of retirement. I really wasn't sure what to expect out of this sequel but the very, very, very last thing I did expect was something boring. I must admit that I was really shocked to see how bland and downright bad this movie was as sadly it's yet another example of a sequel to a good movie being about nothing more than money. The original film was smart, clever and funny in regards to the subject matter but this sequel just lacks any sort of originality and it's really nothing more than a copy of the original. What's so sad is that there could have been so many good and interesting story ideas but sadly we're just given a copy of the first film and we even get many of the same jokes. It's funny to think that the jokes worked so well the first time but here they're just annoying and unfunny. I think the majority of the blame has to go towards the screenplay, which is just a mess. It's never funny, never makes too much sense and sadly it's clear that very little went into it. The performances outside of Tommy Lee Jones really aren't all that memorable either. Lara Flynn Boyle has no problems looking sexy but her character is bland. Rip Torn isn't given much to do and the same is true for Johnny Knoxville and Rosario Dawson. The incredibly bad love story with Dawson is just an embarrassment. MEN IN BLACK II even features some very poor CGI effects and in the end this is just a rather worthless movie that isn't worth the trouble."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":358920,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2002-07-24","keywords":"lingerie,michael jackson character,calzone,video conference,leather outfit","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1097638425","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J needs help so he is sent to find Agent K and restore his memory"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001800/","name":"Rip Torn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0330565/","name":"Robert Gordon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266673/","name":"Barry Fanaro"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black 3
Men in Black 3
programme.desc:
Men in Black 3: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Josh Brolin, Jemaine Clement. Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.'s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1409024/","name":"Men in Black 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NTYxODcwMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDk1NDY0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.'s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1409024/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"3xHCCH"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Josh Brolin Played a Perfect Tommy Lee Jones","reviewBody":"I am not exactly a Will Smith fan. I think the last Will Smith film I watched and liked was the first "Men in Black" film back in 1997. I was surprised to learn that there will be another installment of "Men in Black" this year, the third of the series. The second MiB was shown in 2002, and I did not even care to finish that one. Will the ten years between the last episode and this one make a difference? I needed to see that.

In this film, a vicious alien villain known as Boris the Animal escapes from his prison on the moon, where he had been locked up since being arrested by Agent K (Tommy Lee Jones) back in 1969. One day, Agent K disappears from the present day. His partner Agent J (Will Smith) realizes that K had been assassinated by Boris forty years ago, which caused a major change of events, allowing Boris' alien race to overrun the Earth. J had to find a way to travel back in time to 1969 in order to save K and rectify the tragic consequences of his death. Can J save K and in turn save the Earth from the clutches of Boris?

The odd couple was just as they were before in the first films. Will Smith is still his old loudmouth Agent J as Tommy Lee Jones was his tight-lipped Agent K. As J goes back to the past, he will interact with the young 29-year old K, perfectly played by Josh Brolin. Brolin amazingly captures the laconic persona, and even the distinct voice, of Jones so well that they seemed to have been one and the same actor. It was also good to see Emma Thompson again in a major film as she portrayed Agent O, another senior agent with a soft spot for K. The younger Agent O was played by a cutie named Alice Eve, but she certainly did not convince us that she would look or act like Emma Thompson when she grows older.

I must say that this film was really a most entertaining one. Well, maybe more for me than for my kids. Younger audiences may find the jokes about 1969 cultural references, such as the hippies, the racial tension, etc., to be a bit difficult to grasp. But the fun action sequences with some exciting futuristic vehicles and weaponry, the imaginative and repulsive aliens made by no less than the master monster-maker Rick Baker, the thrilling integration of the historic Apollo 11 lift-off, and the touching revelation of K's big secret made this a very good and enjoyable movie to watch. 3D did not seem necessary. Director Barry Sonnenfeld got it right this time, and this segment certainly gave perfect closure to the story arc of the whole series.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":348757,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2012-05-25","keywords":"escape from prison,neil armstrong character,alien,time travel,cape canaveral florida","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3916407065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J time-jumps back to the year 1969 to take out an alien with its sights on the younger version of Agent K -- a situation that poses a threat to the future of the MIB organization, and humankind's very existence."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000982/","name":"Josh Brolin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316575/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1000113/","name":"Etan Cohen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

I think the last Will Smith film I watched and liked was the first "Men in Black" film back in 1997. I was surprised to learn that there will be another installment of "Men in Black" this year, the third of the series. The second MiB was shown in 2002, and I did not even care to finish that one. Will the ten years between the last episode and this one make a difference? I needed to see that.

In this film, a vicious alien villain known as Boris the Animal escapes from his prison on the moon, where he had been locked up since being arrested by Agent K (Tommy Lee Jones) back in 1969. One day, Agent K disappears from the present day. His partner Agent J (Will Smith) realizes that K had been assassinated by Boris forty years ago, which caused a major change of events, allowing Boris' alien race to overrun the Earth. J had to find a way to travel back in time to 1969 in order to save K and rectify the tragic consequences of his death. Can J save K and in turn save the Earth from the clutches of Boris?

The odd couple was just as they were before in the first films. Will Smith is still his old loudmouth Agent J as Tommy Lee Jones was his tight-lipped Agent K. As J goes back to the past, he will interact with the young 29-year old K, perfectly played by Josh Brolin. Brolin amazingly captures the laconic persona, and even the distinct voice, of Jones so well that they seemed to have been one and the same actor. It was also good to see Emma Thompson again in a major film as she portrayed Agent O, another senior agent with a soft spot for K. The younger Agent O was played by a cutie named Alice Eve, but she certainly did not convince us that she would look or act like Emma Thompson when she grows older.

I must say that this film was really a most entertaining one. Well, maybe more for me than for my kids. Younger audiences may find the jokes about 1969 cultural references, such as the hippies, the racial tension, etc., to be a bit difficult to grasp. But the fun action sequences with some exciting futuristic vehicles and weaponry, the imaginative and repulsive aliens made by no less than the master monster-maker Rick Baker, the thrilling integration of the historic Apollo 11 lift-off, and the touching revelation of K's big secret made this a very good and enjoyable movie to watch. 3D did not seem necessary. Director Barry Sonnenfeld got it right this time, and this segment certainly gave perfect closure to the story arc of the whole series.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":348757,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2012-05-25","keywords":"escape from prison,neil armstrong character,alien,time travel,cape canaveral florida","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3916407065","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J time-jumps back to the year 1969 to take out an alien with its sights on the younger version of Agent K -- a situation that poses a threat to the future of the MIB organization, and humankind's very existence.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000982/","name":"Josh Brolin"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316575/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1000113/","name":"Etan Cohen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"],"duration":"PT1H46M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black
MIB – Men In Black
programme.desc: Men in Black: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Linda Fiorentino, Vincent D'Onofrio. A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119654/","name":"Men in Black","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTlhYTVkMDktYzIyNC00NzlkLTlmN2ItOGEyMWQ4OTA2NDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119654/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"crowrobot"},"dateCreated":"2004-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the best sci-fi comedies ever made.","reviewBody":"As my one line summary says, this is one of the best sci-fi comedies ever made, next to the classic Ghostbusters and the highly underrated Evolution. This movie has action, comedy, and some of the best special effects in the last ten years. Rick Baker, Hollywood's resident 'creature man', as I like to call him, has made such a wide variety of aliens. There's the first alien we see, Mikey; there's the Worm Guys; and the villanous Bug. But there are many others, such as Frank the Pug and the twins. The squid baby is pretty neat. Tommy Lee Jones and Will Smith have an undeniable chemistry together, which repeats itself in the sequel. Linda Fiorentino is also good as the leading lady, and veteran actor Rip Torn is gruff as the head of MIB, Zed. Vincent D'Onofrio is also pretty good. My favorite line: "No, ma'am. We at the FBI do not have a sense of humor that we are aware of." All in all, two thumbs up, baby!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":540588,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1997-07-02","keywords":"alien,pantyhose,superhero,flying saucer,laser gun","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1466737177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A streetwise NYPD detective joins a secret organization that polices extraterrestrial affairs on Earth."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000400/","name":"Linda Fiorentino"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004412/","name":"Ed Solomon"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black II
Men in Black 2
programme.desc:
Men in Black II: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Rip Torn, Lara Flynn Boyle. Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120912/","name":"Men in Black II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxNDA0NTMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDE2NzY2._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120912/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Michael_Elliott"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Sequel About Money","reviewBody":"Men in Black II (2002)

* 1/2 (out of 4) 

Boring and bland sequel has Earth coming under attack from a dangerous alien (Lara Flynn Boyle) so Agent Jay (Will Smith) must bring Agent Kay (Tommy Lee Jones) out of retirement. I really wasn't sure what to expect out of this sequel but the very, very, very last thing I did expect was something boring. I must admit that I was really shocked to see how bland and downright bad this movie was as sadly it's yet another example of a sequel to a good movie being about nothing more than money. The original film was smart, clever and funny in regards to the subject matter but this sequel just lacks any sort of originality and it's really nothing more than a copy of the original. What's so sad is that there could have been so many good and interesting story ideas but sadly we're just given a copy of the first film and we even get many of the same jokes. It's funny to think that the jokes worked so well the first time but here they're just annoying and unfunny. I think the majority of the blame has to go towards the screenplay, which is just a mess. It's never funny, never makes too much sense and sadly it's clear that very little went into it. The performances outside of Tommy Lee Jones really aren't all that memorable either. Lara Flynn Boyle has no problems looking sexy but her character is bland. Rip Torn isn't given much to do and the same is true for Johnny Knoxville and Rosario Dawson. The incredibly bad love story with Dawson is just an embarrassment. MEN IN BLACK II even features some very poor CGI effects and in the end this is just a rather worthless movie that isn't worth the trouble."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":358920,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2002-07-24","keywords":"lingerie,michael jackson character,calzone,video conference,leather outfit","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1097638425","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J needs help so he is sent to find Agent K and restore his memory"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001800/","name":"Rip Torn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0330565/","name":"Robert Gordon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266673/","name":"Barry Fanaro"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black 3
Men in Black 3
programme.desc:
Men in Black 3: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Josh Brolin, Jemaine Clement. Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.'s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1409024/","name":"Men in Black 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NTYxODcwMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDk1NDY0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.'s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1409024/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"3xHCCH"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Josh Brolin Played a Perfect Tommy Lee Jones","reviewBody":"I am not exactly a Will Smith fan. I think the last Will Smith film I watched and liked was the first "Men in Black" film back in 1997. I was surprised to learn that there will be another installment of "Men in Black" this year, the third of the series. The second MiB was shown in 2002, and I did not even care to finish that one. Will the ten years between the last episode and this one make a difference? I needed to see that.

In this film, a vicious alien villain known as Boris the Animal escapes from his prison on the moon, where he had been locked up since being arrested by Agent K (Tommy Lee Jones) back in 1969. One day, Agent K disappears from the present day. His partner Agent J (Will Smith) realizes that K had been assassinated by Boris forty years ago, which caused a major change of events, allowing Boris' alien race to overrun the Earth. J had to find a way to travel back in time to 1969 in order to save K and rectify the tragic consequences of his death. Can J save K and in turn save the Earth from the clutches of Boris?

The odd couple was just as they were before in the first films. Will Smith is still his old loudmouth Agent J as Tommy Lee Jones was his tight-lipped Agent K. As J goes back to the past, he will interact with the young 29-year old K, perfectly played by Josh Brolin. Brolin amazingly captures the laconic persona, and even the distinct voice, of Jones so well that they seemed to have been one and the same actor. It was also good to see Emma Thompson again in a major film as she portrayed Agent O, another senior agent with a soft spot for K. The younger Agent O was played by a cutie named Alice Eve, but she certainly did not convince us that she would look or act like Emma Thompson when she grows older.

I must say that this film was really a most entertaining one. Well, maybe more for me than for my kids. Younger audiences may find the jokes about 1969 cultural references, such as the hippies, the racial tension, etc., to be a bit difficult to grasp. But the fun action sequences with some exciting futuristic vehicles and weaponry, the imaginative and repulsive aliens made by no less than the master monster-maker Rick Baker, the thrilling integration of the historic Apollo 11 lift-off, and the touching revelation of K's big secret made this a very good and enjoyable movie to watch. 3D did not seem necessary. Director Barry Sonnenfeld got it right this time, and this segment certainly gave perfect closure to the story arc of the whole series.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":348757,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2012-05-25","keywords":"escape from prison,neil armstrong character,alien,time travel,cape canaveral florida","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3916407065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J time-jumps back to the year 1969 to take out an alien with its sights on the younger version of Agent K -- a situation that poses a threat to the future of the MIB organization, and humankind's very existence."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000982/","name":"Josh Brolin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316575/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1000113/","name":"Etan Cohen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

I think the last Will Smith film I watched and liked was the first "Men in Black" film back in 1997. I was surprised to learn that there will be another installment of "Men in Black" this year, the third of the series. The second MiB was shown in 2002, and I did not even care to finish that one. Will the ten years between the last episode and this one make a difference? I needed to see that.

In this film, a vicious alien villain known as Boris the Animal escapes from his prison on the moon, where he had been locked up since being arrested by Agent K (Tommy Lee Jones) back in 1969. One day, Agent K disappears from the present day. His partner Agent J (Will Smith) realizes that K had been assassinated by Boris forty years ago, which caused a major change of events, allowing Boris' alien race to overrun the Earth. J had to find a way to travel back in time to 1969 in order to save K and rectify the tragic consequences of his death. Can J save K and in turn save the Earth from the clutches of Boris?

The odd couple was just as they were before in the first films. Will Smith is still his old loudmouth Agent J as Tommy Lee Jones was his tight-lipped Agent K. As J goes back to the past, he will interact with the young 29-year old K, perfectly played by Josh Brolin. Brolin amazingly captures the laconic persona, and even the distinct voice, of Jones so well that they seemed to have been one and the same actor. It was also good to see Emma Thompson again in a major film as she portrayed Agent O, another senior agent with a soft spot for K. The younger Agent O was played by a cutie named Alice Eve, but she certainly did not convince us that she would look or act like Emma Thompson when she grows older.

I must say that this film was really a most entertaining one. Well, maybe more for me than for my kids. Younger audiences may find the jokes about 1969 cultural references, such as the hippies, the racial tension, etc., to be a bit difficult to grasp. But the fun action sequences with some exciting futuristic vehicles and weaponry, the imaginative and repulsive aliens made by no less than the master monster-maker Rick Baker, the thrilling integration of the historic Apollo 11 lift-off, and the touching revelation of K's big secret made this a very good and enjoyable movie to watch. 3D did not seem necessary. Director Barry Sonnenfeld got it right this time, and this segment certainly gave perfect closure to the story arc of the whole series.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":348757,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2012-05-25","keywords":"escape from prison,neil armstrong character,alien,time travel,cape canaveral florida","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3916407065","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J time-jumps back to the year 1969 to take out an alien with its sights on the younger version of Agent K -- a situation that poses a threat to the future of the MIB organization, and humankind's very existence.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000982/","name":"Josh Brolin"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316575/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1000113/","name":"Etan Cohen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"],"duration":"PT1H46M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black
MIB – Men In Black
programme.desc: Men in Black: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Linda Fiorentino, Vincent D'Onofrio. A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119654/","name":"Men in Black","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTlhYTVkMDktYzIyNC00NzlkLTlmN2ItOGEyMWQ4OTA2NDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119654/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"crowrobot"},"dateCreated":"2004-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the best sci-fi comedies ever made.","reviewBody":"As my one line summary says, this is one of the best sci-fi comedies ever made, next to the classic Ghostbusters and the highly underrated Evolution. This movie has action, comedy, and some of the best special effects in the last ten years. Rick Baker, Hollywood's resident 'creature man', as I like to call him, has made such a wide variety of aliens. There's the first alien we see, Mikey; there's the Worm Guys; and the villanous Bug. But there are many others, such as Frank the Pug and the twins. The squid baby is pretty neat. Tommy Lee Jones and Will Smith have an undeniable chemistry together, which repeats itself in the sequel. Linda Fiorentino is also good as the leading lady, and veteran actor Rip Torn is gruff as the head of MIB, Zed. Vincent D'Onofrio is also pretty good. My favorite line: "No, ma'am. We at the FBI do not have a sense of humor that we are aware of." All in all, two thumbs up, baby!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":540588,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1997-07-02","keywords":"alien,pantyhose,superhero,flying saucer,laser gun","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1466737177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A streetwise NYPD detective joins a secret organization that polices extraterrestrial affairs on Earth."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000400/","name":"Linda Fiorentino"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004412/","name":"Ed Solomon"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black II
Men in Black 2
programme.desc:
Men in Black II: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Rip Torn, Lara Flynn Boyle. Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120912/","name":"Men in Black II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxNDA0NTMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDE2NzY2._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120912/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Michael_Elliott"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Sequel About Money","reviewBody":"Men in Black II (2002)

* 1/2 (out of 4) 

Boring and bland sequel has Earth coming under attack from a dangerous alien (Lara Flynn Boyle) so Agent Jay (Will Smith) must bring Agent Kay (Tommy Lee Jones) out of retirement. I really wasn't sure what to expect out of this sequel but the very, very, very last thing I did expect was something boring. I must admit that I was really shocked to see how bland and downright bad this movie was as sadly it's yet another example of a sequel to a good movie being about nothing more than money. The original film was smart, clever and funny in regards to the subject matter but this sequel just lacks any sort of originality and it's really nothing more than a copy of the original. What's so sad is that there could have been so many good and interesting story ideas but sadly we're just given a copy of the first film and we even get many of the same jokes. It's funny to think that the jokes worked so well the first time but here they're just annoying and unfunny. I think the majority of the blame has to go towards the screenplay, which is just a mess. It's never funny, never makes too much sense and sadly it's clear that very little went into it. The performances outside of Tommy Lee Jones really aren't all that memorable either. Lara Flynn Boyle has no problems looking sexy but her character is bland. Rip Torn isn't given much to do and the same is true for Johnny Knoxville and Rosario Dawson. The incredibly bad love story with Dawson is just an embarrassment. MEN IN BLACK II even features some very poor CGI effects and in the end this is just a rather worthless movie that isn't worth the trouble."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":358920,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2002-07-24","keywords":"lingerie,michael jackson character,calzone,video conference,leather outfit","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1097638425","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J needs help so he is sent to find Agent K and restore his memory"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001800/","name":"Rip Torn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0330565/","name":"Robert Gordon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266673/","name":"Barry Fanaro"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black 3
Men in Black 3
programme.desc:
Men in Black 3: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Josh Brolin, Jemaine Clement. Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.'s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1409024/","name":"Men in Black 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NTYxODcwMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDk1NDY0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.'s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1409024/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"3xHCCH"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Josh Brolin Played a Perfect Tommy Lee Jones","reviewBody":"I am not exactly a Will Smith fan. I think the last Will Smith film I watched and liked was the first "Men in Black" film back in 1997. I was surprised to learn that there will be another installment of "Men in Black" this year, the third of the series. The second MiB was shown in 2002, and I did not even care to finish that one. Will the ten years between the last episode and this one make a difference? I needed to see that.

In this film, a vicious alien villain known as Boris the Animal escapes from his prison on the moon, where he had been locked up since being arrested by Agent K (Tommy Lee Jones) back in 1969. One day, Agent K disappears from the present day. His partner Agent J (Will Smith) realizes that K had been assassinated by Boris forty years ago, which caused a major change of events, allowing Boris' alien race to overrun the Earth. J had to find a way to travel back in time to 1969 in order to save K and rectify the tragic consequences of his death. Can J save K and in turn save the Earth from the clutches of Boris?

The odd couple was just as they were before in the first films. Will Smith is still his old loudmouth Agent J as Tommy Lee Jones was his tight-lipped Agent K. As J goes back to the past, he will interact with the young 29-year old K, perfectly played by Josh Brolin. Brolin amazingly captures the laconic persona, and even the distinct voice, of Jones so well that they seemed to have been one and the same actor. It was also good to see Emma Thompson again in a major film as she portrayed Agent O, another senior agent with a soft spot for K. The younger Agent O was played by a cutie named Alice Eve, but she certainly did not convince us that she would look or act like Emma Thompson when she grows older.

I must say that this film was really a most entertaining one. Well, maybe more for me than for my kids. Younger audiences may find the jokes about 1969 cultural references, such as the hippies, the racial tension, etc., to be a bit difficult to grasp. But the fun action sequences with some exciting futuristic vehicles and weaponry, the imaginative and repulsive aliens made by no less than the master monster-maker Rick Baker, the thrilling integration of the historic Apollo 11 lift-off, and the touching revelation of K's big secret made this a very good and enjoyable movie to watch. 3D did not seem necessary. Director Barry Sonnenfeld got it right this time, and this segment certainly gave perfect closure to the story arc of the whole series.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":348757,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2012-05-25","keywords":"escape from prison,neil armstrong character,alien,time travel,cape canaveral florida","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3916407065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J time-jumps back to the year 1969 to take out an alien with its sights on the younger version of Agent K -- a situation that poses a threat to the future of the MIB organization, and humankind's very existence."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000982/","name":"Josh Brolin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316575/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1000113/","name":"Etan Cohen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

I think the last Will Smith film I watched and liked was the first "Men in Black" film back in 1997. I was surprised to learn that there will be another installment of "Men in Black" this year, the third of the series. The second MiB was shown in 2002, and I did not even care to finish that one. Will the ten years between the last episode and this one make a difference? I needed to see that.

In this film, a vicious alien villain known as Boris the Animal escapes from his prison on the moon, where he had been locked up since being arrested by Agent K (Tommy Lee Jones) back in 1969. One day, Agent K disappears from the present day. His partner Agent J (Will Smith) realizes that K had been assassinated by Boris forty years ago, which caused a major change of events, allowing Boris' alien race to overrun the Earth. J had to find a way to travel back in time to 1969 in order to save K and rectify the tragic consequences of his death. Can J save K and in turn save the Earth from the clutches of Boris?

The odd couple was just as they were before in the first films. Will Smith is still his old loudmouth Agent J as Tommy Lee Jones was his tight-lipped Agent K. As J goes back to the past, he will interact with the young 29-year old K, perfectly played by Josh Brolin. Brolin amazingly captures the laconic persona, and even the distinct voice, of Jones so well that they seemed to have been one and the same actor. It was also good to see Emma Thompson again in a major film as she portrayed Agent O, another senior agent with a soft spot for K. The younger Agent O was played by a cutie named Alice Eve, but she certainly did not convince us that she would look or act like Emma Thompson when she grows older.

I must say that this film was really a most entertaining one. Well, maybe more for me than for my kids. Younger audiences may find the jokes about 1969 cultural references, such as the hippies, the racial tension, etc., to be a bit difficult to grasp. But the fun action sequences with some exciting futuristic vehicles and weaponry, the imaginative and repulsive aliens made by no less than the master monster-maker Rick Baker, the thrilling integration of the historic Apollo 11 lift-off, and the touching revelation of K's big secret made this a very good and enjoyable movie to watch. 3D did not seem necessary. Director Barry Sonnenfeld got it right this time, and this segment certainly gave perfect closure to the story arc of the whole series.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":348757,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2012-05-25","keywords":"escape from prison,neil armstrong character,alien,time travel,cape canaveral florida","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3916407065","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J time-jumps back to the year 1969 to take out an alien with its sights on the younger version of Agent K -- a situation that poses a threat to the future of the MIB organization, and humankind's very existence.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000982/","name":"Josh Brolin"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316575/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1000113/","name":"Etan Cohen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"],"duration":"PT1H46M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black
MIB – Men In Black
programme.desc: Men in Black: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Linda Fiorentino, Vincent D'Onofrio. A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119654/","name":"Men in Black","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTlhYTVkMDktYzIyNC00NzlkLTlmN2ItOGEyMWQ4OTA2NDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119654/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"crowrobot"},"dateCreated":"2004-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the best sci-fi comedies ever made.","reviewBody":"As my one line summary says, this is one of the best sci-fi comedies ever made, next to the classic Ghostbusters and the highly underrated Evolution. This movie has action, comedy, and some of the best special effects in the last ten years. Rick Baker, Hollywood's resident 'creature man', as I like to call him, has made such a wide variety of aliens. There's the first alien we see, Mikey; there's the Worm Guys; and the villanous Bug. But there are many others, such as Frank the Pug and the twins. The squid baby is pretty neat. Tommy Lee Jones and Will Smith have an undeniable chemistry together, which repeats itself in the sequel. Linda Fiorentino is also good as the leading lady, and veteran actor Rip Torn is gruff as the head of MIB, Zed. Vincent D'Onofrio is also pretty good. My favorite line: "No, ma'am. We at the FBI do not have a sense of humor that we are aware of." All in all, two thumbs up, baby!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":540588,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1997-07-02","keywords":"alien,pantyhose,superhero,flying saucer,laser gun","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1466737177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A streetwise NYPD detective joins a secret organization that polices extraterrestrial affairs on Earth."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000400/","name":"Linda Fiorentino"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004412/","name":"Ed Solomon"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

Linda Fiorentino is also good as the leading lady, and veteran actor Rip Torn is gruff as the head of MIB, Zed. Vincent D'Onofrio is also pretty good. My favorite line: "No, ma'am. We at the FBI do not have a sense of humor that we are aware of." All in all, two thumbs up, baby!","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":540588,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1997-07-02","keywords":"alien,pantyhose,superhero,flying saucer,laser gun","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1466737177","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A streetwise NYPD detective joins a secret organization that polices extraterrestrial affairs on Earth.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000400/","name":"Linda Fiorentino"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004412/","name":"Ed Solomon"],"duration":"PT1H38M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black II
Men in Black 2
programme.desc:
Men in Black II: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Rip Torn, Lara Flynn Boyle. Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120912/","name":"Men in Black II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxNDA0NTMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDE2NzY2._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120912/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Michael_Elliott"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Sequel About Money","reviewBody":"Men in Black II (2002)

* 1/2 (out of 4) 

Boring and bland sequel has Earth coming under attack from a dangerous alien (Lara Flynn Boyle) so Agent Jay (Will Smith) must bring Agent Kay (Tommy Lee Jones) out of retirement. I really wasn't sure what to expect out of this sequel but the very, very, very last thing I did expect was something boring. I must admit that I was really shocked to see how bland and downright bad this movie was as sadly it's yet another example of a sequel to a good movie being about nothing more than money. The original film was smart, clever and funny in regards to the subject matter but this sequel just lacks any sort of originality and it's really nothing more than a copy of the original. What's so sad is that there could have been so many good and interesting story ideas but sadly we're just given a copy of the first film and we even get many of the same jokes. It's funny to think that the jokes worked so well the first time but here they're just annoying and unfunny. I think the majority of the blame has to go towards the screenplay, which is just a mess. It's never funny, never makes too much sense and sadly it's clear that very little went into it. The performances outside of Tommy Lee Jones really aren't all that memorable either. Lara Flynn Boyle has no problems looking sexy but her character is bland. Rip Torn isn't given much to do and the same is true for Johnny Knoxville and Rosario Dawson. The incredibly bad love story with Dawson is just an embarrassment. MEN IN BLACK II even features some very poor CGI effects and in the end this is just a rather worthless movie that isn't worth the trouble."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":358920,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2002-07-24","keywords":"lingerie,michael jackson character,calzone,video conference,leather outfit","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1097638425","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J needs help so he is sent to find Agent K and restore his memory"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001800/","name":"Rip Torn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0330565/","name":"Robert Gordon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266673/","name":"Barry Fanaro"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black 3
Men in Black 3
programme.desc:
Men in Black 3: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Josh Brolin, Jemaine Clement. Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.'s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1409024/","name":"Men in Black 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NTYxODcwMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDk1NDY0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.'s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1409024/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"3xHCCH"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Josh Brolin Played a Perfect Tommy Lee Jones","reviewBody":"I am not exactly a Will Smith fan. I think the last Will Smith film I watched and liked was the first "Men in Black" film back in 1997. I was surprised to learn that there will be another installment of "Men in Black" this year, the third of the series. The second MiB was shown in 2002, and I did not even care to finish that one. Will the ten years between the last episode and this one make a difference? I needed to see that.

In this film, a vicious alien villain known as Boris the Animal escapes from his prison on the moon, where he had been locked up since being arrested by Agent K (Tommy Lee Jones) back in 1969. One day, Agent K disappears from the present day. His partner Agent J (Will Smith) realizes that K had been assassinated by Boris forty years ago, which caused a major change of events, allowing Boris' alien race to overrun the Earth. J had to find a way to travel back in time to 1969 in order to save K and rectify the tragic consequences of his death. Can J save K and in turn save the Earth from the clutches of Boris?

The odd couple was just as they were before in the first films. Will Smith is still his old loudmouth Agent J as Tommy Lee Jones was his tight-lipped Agent K. As J goes back to the past, he will interact with the young 29-year old K, perfectly played by Josh Brolin. Brolin amazingly captures the laconic persona, and even the distinct voice, of Jones so well that they seemed to have been one and the same actor. It was also good to see Emma Thompson again in a major film as she portrayed Agent O, another senior agent with a soft spot for K. The younger Agent O was played by a cutie named Alice Eve, but she certainly did not convince us that she would look or act like Emma Thompson when she grows older.

I must say that this film was really a most entertaining one. Well, maybe more for me than for my kids. Younger audiences may find the jokes about 1969 cultural references, such as the hippies, the racial tension, etc., to be a bit difficult to grasp. But the fun action sequences with some exciting futuristic vehicles and weaponry, the imaginative and repulsive aliens made by no less than the master monster-maker Rick Baker, the thrilling integration of the historic Apollo 11 lift-off, and the touching revelation of K's big secret made this a very good and enjoyable movie to watch. 3D did not seem necessary. Director Barry Sonnenfeld got it right this time, and this segment certainly gave perfect closure to the story arc of the whole series.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":348757,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2012-05-25","keywords":"escape from prison,neil armstrong character,alien,time travel,cape canaveral florida","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3916407065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J time-jumps back to the year 1969 to take out an alien with its sights on the younger version of Agent K -- a situation that poses a threat to the future of the MIB organization, and humankind's very existence."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000982/","name":"Josh Brolin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316575/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1000113/","name":"Etan Cohen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 0408381, Title: Doc Martin, --- Description: Doc Martin: Created by Dominic Minghella, Mark Crowdy, Craig Ferguson. With Martin Clunes, Caroline Catz, Ian McNeice, Joe Absolom. The trials and tribulations of Dr. Martin Ellingham (Martin Clunes), a socially challenged doctor who moves from London to the picturesque village of Port Wenn in Cornwall." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0408381/","name":"Doc Martin","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWNmMTAxZTAtNzNhZS00MThhLWJmMmEtYWExZGUzODkxMmM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjExMjk0ODk@._V1_.jpg","description":"The trials and tribulations of Dr. Martin Ellingham (Martin Clunes), a socially challenged doctor who moves from London to the picturesque village of Port Wenn in Cornwall.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0408381/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"groggo","dateCreated":"2007-12-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Brits Know How to Do It","reviewBody":"Doc Martin is so unusual and wonderfully off-kilter that it becomes addictive within 20 minutes of exposure. 

The titular Doc is a guy who was probably a curmudgeon before puberty. He's a surgeon from sophisticated, worldly London who moves to (fictional) Portwenn on the coast of Cornwall because he suddenly becomes ill at the sight of blood. This is not a good omen for a surgeon. He quits to become a general practitioner and he's satisfied, thanks very much, with checkups, prescriptions and referrals.

The foul-mannered, blunt-spoken Doc smugly considers himself above the crowd, but he soon learns he is really BELOW the crowd, out of step with Portwenn's eccentricities, value systems and peculiar burghers, who make the mere lunatics of London look normal by comparison.

Martin Clunes is terrific in the lead role. He is a tall, charismatic and not exactly handsome actor who looks like he would be more comfortable playing cops and heavies. He is, instead, a consummate comic actor. His facial and physical comedy, his frequent bouts of exasperation and bewilderment, are things to behold. (Note: some wags have compared him to 'House,' from the popular TV drama of the same name. House is played by Hugh Laurie, another splendid Brit, and that's about where the comparison begins and ends. They are two very different characters in two very different shows.)

Portwenn's local population, with its twisted logic that somehow makes perfect sense, is represented through the tour-de-force acting of supporting players: Bert (Ian McNeice, who always dazzles playing offbeat, world-weary philosophical characters); Louise (the charming and beautiful Caroline Catz), who either loves Martin or wants to kill him; corn-rowed Elaine (lovely Lucy Punch) as the ditzy assistant with her own set of secretarial ethics; and Doc's Aunt Joan (the great Stephanie Cole, who has been delighting audiences since the 1960s).

Dominic Minghella, he of the Minghella mob of talented artists (brother Anthony directed 'The English Patient'), is the brains behind this brilliant controlled chaos.

Don't miss this program. TV shows that are both funny AND intelligent are the rarest of TV fare.

And a fast footnote: let us all bow our heads and pray that Hollywood doesn't try to remake this.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14318,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2004-09-02","keywords":"socially awkward man,doctor,opposites attract,fear of blood,rural setting","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0167340/","name":"Martin Clunes","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0146414/","name":"Caroline Catz","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0573862/","name":"Ian McNeice"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103911/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0136637/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0591286/","name":"Dominic Minghella","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0189596/","name":"Mark Crowdy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0272401/","name":"Craig Ferguson"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Doc Martin: Series 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2606414105","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWU0NDQ5NTctYjJmOC00MmRjLWEwYzItYjNjYzllNTY2YWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWU0NDQ5NTctYjJmOC00MmRjLWEwYzItYjNjYzllNTY2YWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Doc Martin: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0479842, Title: Pastewka, --- Description: Pastewka: With Bastian Pastewka, Sonsee Neu, Bettina Lamprecht, Matthias Matschke. A show about the fictional everyday adventures of real-life comedian Bastian Pastewka. He experiences funny, strange and embarrassing moments often caused by his lies." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0479842/","name":"Pastewka","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTA5OWE1MTQtZWI0MS00NmQ2LTg2OGMtMzgxZmNiOTU3OGM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjYxMTgzMzQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A show about the fictional everyday adventures of real-life comedian Bastian Pastewka. He experiences funny, strange and embarrassing moments often caused by his lies.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0479842/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"chnutscher","dateCreated":"2019-01-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Outstandig german comedy serie.","reviewBody":"Outstandig german comedy serie.

The first 5 or so seasons are somewhat conventional comedy with standalone episodes (all of about 30mins). With continuity what concerns the actors and figures, but lesser what concerns the overall story. Nevertheless, it is not the usual comedy delivering cheap laughs every 2 minutes. The hole serie has excellent and very elaborated scripts with good stories, which slowly build up to fewer funny moments. In this regard it is an intelligent comedy with limited, but mature jokes that are really funny. No cheap, cheesy sketch-like usual stuff, nor the usual sitcom-like rushed action. Also the background stories do reflect a variety of everyday human conditions. Season 8 was a somewhat different approach with fewer explicit comedy elements, more focused on telling an odd and strange story, I still liked it. Season 9 switched to complete continuity of the story and IMO excels also with a somewhat hidden criticism of the shallow productions of the german TV, which in fact is very dependant on the contributions of the state TV under public law and fees.

A very good serie. And it has to be said, within german standards, absolutely outstanding. An exception within the flood of conventional, political correct and boring german series, where there seems to be truly a conspiracy for a focus on the inflational production of mediocre or average BS.

An insider tip for foreigners settling in the german language area and getting used to it.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3487,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8,"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2005-09-09","keywords":"21st century,german humor,german,rappelkiste,rappelkiste tshirt","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0665002/","name":"Bastian Pastewka","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0014291/","name":"Sonsee Neu","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1260940/","name":"Bettina Lamprecht"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0254210/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0188322/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer Finale Staffel [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1330691865","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTc4MGEzZDYtYTU3NS00MWNlLWE1ZDItOTBjMGY0MjlkOTNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTc4MGEzZDYtYTU3NS00MWNlLWE1ZDItOTBjMGY0MjlkOTNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 1600194, Title: Hawaii Five-0, --- Description: Hawaii Five-0: Created by Peter M. Lenkov, Alex Kurtzman, Leonard Freeman, Roberto Orci. With Alex O'Loughlin, Scott Caan, Taylor Wily, Daniel Dae Kim. Steve McGarrett returns home to Oahu in order to find his father's killer; The Governor offers him the chance to run his own task force - Five-0." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1600194/","name":"Hawaii Five-0","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGMxNDUxMzMtNTgwZS00ZjVlLTkyNmUtNGEzYzQ0YjY3OTAxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Steve McGarrett returns home to Oahu in order to find his father's killer; The Governor offers him the chance to run his own task force - Five-0.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1600194/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jodogo59","dateCreated":"2010-09-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Shows Promise but...","reviewBody":"Let's start with arguably the best and most recognized TV score of all time. If the producers want to use the original theme song, then why shorten it? It reminded me of the truncated TV tunes of re-runs in syndication.

Now for the pilot episode. I thought it odd that Hawaii 5-0 would open with a scene in South Korea. It's like stumbling out of bed in the morning not exactly sure what you're going to do that day.

There are also seemed to be to much gun play and not enough acting. The dialog and some of the background setup (Danno's family situation, for example) was a bit too cliché. Some of the personal background could be better developed over time rather than cramming it into one episode while chasing the bad guys.

The overall storyline for the pilot was excellent, though. It gave background to 5-0's beginnings and it maintained a certain consistency and plausibility with TOS while adding the dimension of McGarrett and his father.

Some of the dialog resulted in an approving chuckle from me.

The episode began to gel about 2/3 in and by the end of the show, I felt comfortable with the main characters and looked forward to the next chapter.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70221,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2010-09-20","keywords":"teamwork,yakuza,police,hawaii,swimwear","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1533927/","name":"Alex O'Loughlin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004790/","name":"Scott Caan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1711334/","name":"Taylor Wily"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176022/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0314568/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006997/","name":"Peter M. On Christmas Eve, three lifelong friends spend the night in New York City looking for the Holy Grail of Christmas parties." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3530002/","name":"The Night Before","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyNDY1ODQwNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA2MjUwNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"On Christmas Eve, three lifelong friends spend the night in New York City looking for the Holy Grail of Christmas parties.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3530002/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jasonchhangur"},"dateCreated":"2018-12-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Laughed through the whole thing","reviewBody":"Can't understand people watching this moving looking for the next mircle on 34th Street....if you watch this for what it is...you will find it hits all the right numbers. programme.title: Bad Santa
Bad Santa
programme.desc:
Bad Santa: Directed by Terry Zwigoff. With Billy Bob Thornton, Tony Cox, Brett Kelly, Lauren Graham. A miserable conman and his partner pose as Santa and his Little Helper to rob department stores on Christmas Eve. But they run into problems when the conman befriends a troubled kid." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0307987/","name":"Bad Santa","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4Njg1MDcwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMzAxNjM3._V1_.jpg","description":"A miserable conman and his partner pose as Santa and his Little Helper to rob department stores on Christmas Eve. But they run into problems when the conman befriends a troubled kid.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0307987/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sfwriter999"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the funniest movies for a long time","reviewBody":"I saw the trailers and knew what I was in for when I went to see Bad Santa. It's not Nice Santa or Naughty Santa, but BAAADD SANTA, horribly drunk and disorderly Santa. Rude and Crude Santa.

I laughed until tears streamed down my face.

There is a lot of sexual situations and profanity, but you have to look past it. Those sensitive to foul language should not watch this movie nor FOUR WEDDINGS AND A FUNERAL. This is not a kiddie movie, but a movie made for adults.

Compared to ELF, SANTA CLAUSE, and a whole raft of other so-so Christmas related comedies, this is one of the best. Most holiday humor movies are always on the lightside with an eye to the children market during the holidays. This one ranks in there with A Christmas STORY and PLANES, TRAINS, AND AUTOMOBILES and THE GRINCH WHO STOLE Christmas (cartoon version).

BAD SANTA is Christmas at its darkest, full of profanity, bad people, and evil deeds. But at the heart of it is a small bit of caring by one Bad Santa.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":139245,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-11-26","keywords":"christmas,christmas eve,heaving bosom,intercourse,stripper","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bad Santa: Blu-Ray","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3375209497","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzA0M2EyMjktYmNlOS00MGQ1LTkzOTEtY2FiNGQ2OWM5M2Q4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzA0M2EyMjktYmNlOS00MGQ1LTkzOTEtY2FiNGQ2OWM5M2Q4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Bad Santa"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000671/","name":"Billy Bob Thornton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005170/","name":"Bernie Mac"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0334179/","name":"Lauren Graham"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0959062/","name":"Terry Zwigoff"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019626/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114964/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275629/","name":"Glenn Ficarra"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0720135/","name":"John Requa"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ray
programme.desc: Elevé par sa mère dans le sud ségrégationniste des Etats-Unis, Ray Robinson est frappé de cécité totale à l'âge de 7 ans. Adolescent, le jeune pianiste décide de tenter sa chance à Seattle, alors capitale de la nouvelle scène jazz. Une fois sur place, le musicien est engagé comme remplaçant dans un club tenu d’une main de fer par une certaine Marlene Andres. Grâce à son talent, Ray s’y impose rapidement, mais la voie vers le succès est semée d’embûches. À la recherche de son propre style, la future star se heurte bientôt à des maisons de disques prédatrices.

programme.title: 8 Mile
programme.desc: Überraschend gutes Aufsteigerdrama mit Eminem.

programme.title: Dune
programme.desc: En 10191, l’empereur Padishah Shaddam IV, de la planète Kaitain, règne sur l’Univers Connu. Se sentant menacé par les Atréides, de la planète Caladan, il noue une alliance avec les Harkonnens, de la planète Giedi Prime, pour les exterminer. Afin de mener à bien son funeste projet, il envoie les Atréides sur la planète Arrakis, également appelée Dune, source de la substance précieuse : l’épice. Sur place, les Atréides sont massacrés par les terribles Harkonnens. Deux des Atréides échappent au massacre : Paul, l’héritier du trône, et sa mère, lady Jessica.

programme.title: Contrebande
programme.desc: Véritable légende de la contrebande, Chris Farraday s’est rangé des voitures depuis quelques années pour gagner honnêtement sa vie avec sa petite société de systèmes de sécurité. Mais son beau-frère, pas trop futé, a pris le relais à son insu. Et a balancé une grosse quantité de drogue à l’eau pour échapper aux policiers fluviaux. Dès lors, ses commanditaires le contraignent à réaliser un très gros coup pour les rembourser. Une opération bien trop compliquée pour lui. Par esprit de famille, Chris reprend du service sur un navire dont le capitaine le déteste cordialement.

programme.title: Salt
programme.desc: Agent hors pair de la CIA, l'Américaine Evelyn Salt a la confiance absolue de son patron, Ted Winter. Jusqu'au jour où elle se retrouve accusée d'être une espionne au service de la Russie. N'ayant pour seul recours que la fuite, elle devient la cible numéro un. Seule contre tous, en danger permanent, elle décide de mener l'enquête pour découvrir l'identité de ceux qui veulent la compromettre.
